description: Authentic, fresh, delicious local Mexican food! The salsas are made fresh and so are the amazing tortillas. I always come for the sopa de pollo. And not to mention, really great prices.
author: Nina R.

description:
It's a great location for a Mexican food place with fun decor unfortunately the customer service and the food really missed the mark.  It's basically Mexican food for people who don't know what Mexican food is supposed to taste like. Super bland that even the peas in the rice where a dominant flavor. 
Only redemption was that the spiciest salsa on the bar was delicious. 
Won't be back.
author: Angel M.

description:
Thoughts of warding off the chilly morning with some comfort food had me stopping by Pancho's for take out.

Sopa de pollo (Mexican-style hot chicken soup $9.95 per bowl) would sure hit the spot.

Unfortunately what I got was a bowl of hearty but very bland soup. 

I squeezed the wedge of lime to give the broth a shot of citrus. And the soup had a bit of umph that disappeared in a flash. Spoonful after spoonful through fresh vegetables - carrots, onions, potato, celery and even bits of fresh avocado - as well as good sized chunks of chicken meat and rice, I was searching for that elusive satisfying bite. Never found it.

Besides the tortilla that came with the soup, I did enjoy the complimentary warm house tortilla chips with pico de gallo salsa.

Maybe I picked up the soup far too early in the day so the flavor had not had time to meld together from all the ingredients? But darn, I was so disappointed that my fond memory has been shattered.

Would I be willing to try Pancho's soup again? 

Yes, I would. But next time I'll keep in mind to stop by later in the day and hope the cook had the foresight to set the pot rolling with the soup early and that he remembered to season it well.
author: Joanna T.

description: No salsa sent with my bland burrito!! And the bag came with literally 5 chips. Why even send those?
author: Karishma M.

description:
"I'd like to order a torta with charred al pastor meat," said NO ONE EVER, but apparently that's what I must have said because that's what I got.  Sooooooo in this TORTA, you get maybe ten pieces of cut up meat squares, a smear of beans, shreds of lettuce, salsa (code for tomato), and mayo.... ALL FOR $10. Not worth it.  Could not enjoy it because the crunch of meat was not pleasant. 
Hubby ordered huevos rancheros. Being Mexican and from the hood, he knows what those should taste like...he gave them three stars.  Tricky part: trying to eat then with plastic utensils- May the force be con usted (with you).

Is this a MUST stop and try place??? Definitely not.
author: Silvia D.

description: Quality at a reasonable price. Visiting town on business. Found Pancho's passing by on way to Bob's donuts a couple years ago. Dinner at Pancho's, dessert at Bob's Donuts has become a go-to combination. A burrito, chips, salsa, & a drink with a street view = satisfying.
author: Jim M.

description: I ate here three times and had three different things. Each time the food sucked and the service is horrible. We asked for the guacamole they forgot to give us and the guy said sorry we're too busy to deal with it. On top of that they are super slow! Never going back
author: Theo H.

description:
My favorite vegetarian burrito EVER. They do fajita veggies, which take the burrito to the next level. Excellent salsa bar and low beer prices. 
Love you Pancho's!
author: Isabella A.

description:
I love this little place on Polk street.  Just a little Mexican joint.  Everything is on point (I suppose I would prefer a few more salsa choices in the salsa bar, but I am quibbling)

The chips are thin and house-made, as are the corn tortillas. Get the carnitas.
author: Amy W.

description: Very good local Mexican restaurant with freshly made corn tortillas. We had two taco's with Carnitas and Carne Asada were both VERY fresh. Their accompanying beans and rice and their complementary chips with excellent salsas from their salsa bar are a must. Don't be fooled by some negative reviews this place is worth the trip!
author: Timothy P.

description: Not a bad little slice of Mexico.  Steak nachos were pretty good, and the cheese quesadilla was decent (that's all our kids ordered... we had clam chowder from Swan's).  Cozy place with EXCELLENT service!  Quick, hot food!
author: David L.

description: Low quality. No flavor. I wish this place was good as its convenient. I won't be going back.
author: Jane C.

description:
Don't EVER use your CC at this location!! Personally I will never step foot inside this location again. Yesterday I ordered a beer and fajita burrito. The cashier charged me for a water when I didn't order it, no big deal she gave me cash back for it. She kept the receipt to show her boss she had to refund me $4. My burrito when I got it was shrimp not steak. The following day I noticed 2 charges on my acct. I called my bank they did verify I was charged twice. I informed them I would be going to the restaurant and ask for cash back otherwise I would dispute the charges. 
I get to the restaurant the 2 ladies cooking completely ignored me when I walked in and saw me waiting to be assisted. 3 times I had to ask of someone would help me? Both ladies after I explained myself kept saying "wait for the manager" one of the ladies doubted I was there the previous night. I showed her a pic of myself and friends at the restaurant. She zoomed in all around the pic to make sure it was there location. I showed them the charges from my bank too. Finally the actual manager showed up, he told me they got a new credit card machine and I could have up to 4 charges. Really?? In what country? The conversation escalated into an argument. I had to tell him "let's call the cops to get this resolved!" He was rude, arrogant, kept telling me when a business gets a new credit card machine customers could have multiple charges. Who does he think he's fooling?? I finally got my money back. 
Not only will I never go back, I told him I would write a bad review on ever site possible (he said he didn't care!) but I'll never spend my money there again. The food wasn't all that good anyway!
author: Rosie R.

description:
After reading a bunch of reviews, I decided I needed to try this place out for myself.  

I ordered two carnitas tacos and one borracho burrito for $18.  The carnitas inside the taco were tasty and the taco shell was more unique than your average tortilla.  I'm a fan of crunchy tacos, and these were on the softer side.   Not too much going on with the tacos unless you visit the salsa bar and load it up. The salsa bar is similar to other businesses, hot/med salsa, pico de gallo, a mix of cilantro/onions, jalapeños, or a green avocado sauce.

You'll either love or dislike the borracho burrito.  The bbq sauce inside throws a different flavor at you that might not be what you're looking for.  I personally would not get it again.  I like traditional grilled/marinaded flavors.  Also, I love normal Mexican rice.  This place seemed to go with the chipotle train and has what appears to be white rice.   

Overall, the food wasn't bad.  Yet it didn't leave me excited to come back again.  And, I ate everything.  So it was very filling.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Heather H was shocked and appalled to see that her favorite burrito joint got slapped with notice of closure and fined with a health hazard. 
Hopefully, they will get their act together and cleanliness is the first marching orders. C'mon Panchos, don't let us down for God sake! You are the only authentic Mexican food in white nob hill/Polk gulch! don't let us down!
author: Jill F.

description: I am a Mexican from West Texas, full of Mexican restaurants. I came to San Francisco to find one of the best places I have even eaten at!!
author: Isela V.

description:
It's a great neighborhood restaurant, good burritos and very fair prices.  I've definitely had mixed experiences here, food can be bland but the service is always friendly!

Definitely more of a pick-up and go situation because there isn't a whole ton of seating. However, this place is never too crowded so it's easy to find seating if you do choose to dine-in.
author: Celia L.

description:
The Borracho Burrito, really good. Very satisfying. Tortilla was very different and unique. 
The Taquitos Dorados, very flavorful. Good and fresh ingredients.. Staff was very nice, friendly and very accommodating. The food is prepared Fresh and to order.. The place decor is authentic, I felt like I was in México.
author: Felix E.

description: Encaladas description specifically says it comes with 2 per order.  I repeatedly told the lady taking my order my request. Went to pay and noticed my receipt that she charged me for two orders. I asked for my money back and she refused becaus they already made it.
author: Philip F.

description: It is the best burrito ever.. no but it is darn good. I love getting the carnitas burrito. It is a good size and it comes with chips in case you need more. The salsa bar has this wonderful orange salsa that is medium spice and so good. The people there are very friendly and it is usually super quick. Pretty good place pretty good food. Pretty good all around.
author: Jazlyn H.

description: Handmade chips, check. What looks like handmade tortillas, real good. Salsa selection is also good. Personable and real people, check. Early hours, check. Location, double check. Authentic? better than SoCal? Who cares. It's good and I would recommend this local taqueria for sure.
author: Juls C.

description: This is a good taqueria. The customer service is very good. The place is clean. It does get crowded on the weekends at night. Pretty standard menu. It has everything a taqueria should have except for chorizo meat. Based on my previous visits I liked the Pancho's Nacho with Steak. It was well made and filling. Their Tostadas / Taco Salad was okay.  Their burritos were okay. This is the best Taqueria in the upper Polk area. I would definitely come here again if I had a craving for Tex-Mex food.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
Never been sick from eating here, clean and you see them constantly picking up around the salsa bar.  Never seen roaches so not sure of those 1 star reviews.

GREAT veggie options as well.  I don't why some of the patrons think that because it's a salsa bar that they can take 8oz to go.  Bad form and feel bad for the staff when people ask for a large containers to go. 

 My go to burrito spot on polk.  Super polite and consistent.
author: Robert M.

description: The food was so delicious! I got a steak and shrimp burrito and absolutely loved it. Great large size and very friendly staff. Overall great experience!
author: Ali R.

description:
AWFUL! I ordered delivery from this place and my whole order was messed up. They forgot my drinks and my sides that my meal came with!! Their phone was busy every time I tried to call to remedy the situation.  HOW CONVENIENT! 

The food was SO BLAND and when you order takeout they don't give you any salsa options. The salsa that comes with the chips and salsa is chunky pico de gallo. Picture big chunks of tomatoes and raw onions. SO MEDIOCRE. We couldn't even eat the chips and salsa properly because the salsa was so chunky and heavy and the chips were so thin they kept breaking. We had to spoon it over each chip. 

NEVER EVER AGAIN.
author: Jane R.

description: This place is so-so. The only reason why I gave it four stars is because of their homemade tortillas, and their guacamole. Everything else is a solid three, but I keep coming back for their tortillas and because I think their better than other options nearby for Mexican food. Also their mole and horchata are pretty good. And don't order to-go, it's just a cold sloppy mess and then there's no point in soft, warm fresh tortillas.
author: Gina B.

description:
ROACHES they're brave enough to wander the floors, walls and signs mid afternoon too.

I saw at least a dozen in the half hour I was there...
author: William B.

description: I eat here a lot because it's less than a block from my place. The quality is average -- get the quesadilla if you want a small bite and the burrito is good but nothing special. Their meat can be a little on the dry side. What's fun though is the red hot sauce. It's HOT. Typically I stock up on 3-4 hot sauce containers at the typical Mexican joint but here I only take 1 back. Yes, it's that hot and that good.
author: Young Y.

description: The food was very good, authentic Mexican. Worth the little walk, a bit over priced I think but the portions are hearty. We would be back, maybe to split a meal considering the portion and price. Staff is nice and serves quickly.
author: Mariah P.

description:
Taco Tuesday Review #1 needs to go to my neighborhood joint which I have frequented many many times.  Pancho's Salsa Bar is a fine place to get some Mexican food, particularly to-go, if you are living on this stretch of Polk Gulch.  It is also exceedingly unspectacular - which you can evaluate in different ways.  Unspectacular isn't necessarily bad.  It also means that this is not a place that you go out of your way to visit.  I have visited many times, though, because it is not bad at all and has a few nice features going in it's favor.

So, Pancho's is a chain but I don't believe that it is a big chain.  This location is on Polk Street as it transitioned over to the truly Nob Hill and then Russian Hill end of The City.  Pancho's is a pretty casual place with a nice vibe.  The food it pretty run of the mill, more on the end of a fast casual with a few entrees.  I think the menu is pretty limited relative to a more traditional Mexican place.  They have Burritos, and the options are listed out based on meat choices.  Same with Tacos.  Meat choices are Steak, Chicken, Carnitas and Shrimp.  So, not the big range.  They also offer about a half dozen entrees, such as Rolled Tacos, Tostadas (really should be called a Taco Salad), Tortas, Soup, Enchiladas and three combo platters.  All in all, not a ton of options.  You can't add a taco on the side.  The prices are in the $8/9 range for the Burritos and the $11 range for the entrees with meat.  

I find the food to be a little bland and uninteresting.  Not bad, though.  I enjoy getting the Tostada (Taco Salad) even though I'd prefer less filler.  Rice in a Taco Salad?  The Burritos are just alright, however the Boracho Burrito with the sauce included it pretty tasty.  One of the Pancho's signatures is the homemade tortillas - I think that the Tacos are very bland, even with Guacamole.  You can load up at the Salsa Bar and flavor up your food if you want.  They have a nice little Salsa Bar.  One thing I will say is that I love that they always offer a $2 Tecate while you wait for your take out.  And again, the environment is nice enough.  I'll also add, I do have a few friends who like this place more than me - I'm not quite so crazy about it.  To be fair, you won't get awful food here, they have decent standards.  Just, not super interesting.  

All in all, I would not seek out the food, but I am happy to get it to-go since I live a few blocks away and this is the nice end of Polk Street.  But, I'd prefer the folks at El Super Burrito a few blocks closer to the Loin for food that is much more down home and flavorful.
author: Adam S.

description: This little hole in the wall is awesome! Authentic, flavorful mexican food at a reasonable price. I came in and had the Huevos Rancheros. They were delicious! Crispy corn tortillas smothered in red sauce with two fried eggs and rice and beans. Washed it down with an ice cold Lagumitas IPA. Fresh salsa bar, very clean dining room with lots of character. Will def be back!
author: Devon C.

description: Excellent service excellent food tasty and delicious i recomend this place to everyone friends family tourists
author: Roberto R.

description:
A very unassuming place with lots of homemade taste.

Pancho's may be small in space but it's big in flavor. The staff is friendly and very welcoming. Their options are varied and well described with options ranging in healthy to I'm just hungry. The latter was my approach. 

After placing my order, I was given a good portion of chips and made my own salsa selection at their self-serve salsa bar. Their pico de gallo and medium salsa are both colorful and full of flavor. Not overbearing and too hot. I was served my Sopa de Pollo which once again was generously served with shredded chicken and an assortment of vegetables. The meat was cooked right and seemed very fresh. The flavor of the soup was good and not on the salty side, which can indicate that it has been sitting in the pot foe a while
 The vegetables and potatoes were just right. The Steak and Shrimp burrito in a wheat tortilla was huge! Again the flavors of the black beans and its condiments welcomed you to a  Mexo-Caribbean experience. The shrimps and steak were balanced throughout the burrito and even though there was more beans than shrimp or steak, the flavors never waivered. All in all, it was a great meal and the place is clean and lacking that usual kitchen or bathroom smell that can ruin a meal.  Since I have been here many locals, have been picking up their orders continuously. 
Great service, good food and great place. If my abuelita was alive, I would bring her here. 
Buen provecho.
author: Charly D.

description: Just moved to area. Got this place first time. I cannot believe how bland this was. They use the same low quality steak in their taco as what they call their fajita. I will not be back here. Food was low  quality and no flavor
author: Matt R.

description: I eat here 3-5 times a week. Steak and prawn or chicken burrito is what I always get and at this point, am pretty dependent on them. Keep up the good work panchos
author: Sean D.

description: I feel so disappointed after having to -go lunch from that place ! My order was chicken quesadilla and shrimp tacos . First at all their stuff is overpriced - small chicken quesadilla was around 9 $which too much for such size ! And all the filling was proportioned very unequally inside ! But the taste was not bad , more good than bad ! The complete catastrophe were Tacos -  too much fried and so fat ! But the fact which pissed me off then for 10 dollars for 2 pieces of tacos I got  small cheap shitty  baby shrimps ! I got used eating tacos with bigger sized shrimps ! So , I'm not sure about other stuff they have , and obviously won't ever be , but 20 doll for such a disgusting lunch   Made me feel very unpleasant ! Costumer service as usual -nothing to complain except but regular Latino poker faces .
author: Vadzim S.

description: My order is never correct! I've ordered food on like 4 separate occasions and it's never right! I recommend eating at the restaurant. In all honesty the food is great, they have hand made tortillas! My review is based on service, not food.
author: Vince M.

description:
Pancho's has been around a long time and is my only viable neighborhood option for my burrito fix. It certainly looks the part - I love all the vintage signs. There's even an autographed picture of Jose Iglesias next to my favorite table. Service is generally friendly (with rare exceptions) and prompt.

Food-wise, they do certain things very well here. I like their carnitas burritos and their fish tacos. The tacos are served on uniquely thick handmade soft tortillas, which I don't get often enough (because I'm so obsessed with burritos). Their chips are also great - light and crispy and not too oily. I like the salsa. Sometimes I wish they had more varieties, but the ones they make are good.

I have enjoyed their breakfast dishes, but it's important to read and comprehend the ingredients carefully before ordering. Otherwise you might end up with a huge plate of eggs scrambled with lots of sliced jalapeños (meaning that, even if it's too spicy, picking out the peppers doesn't make it much less spicy at all). I like spicy food but that one was a little beyond me. (I still ate the whole thing, which says something, though probably more about me than the restaurant.) Again, I urge you to read the menu at the counter carefully before ordering breakfast. The breakfast burrito is a good choice.

I actually avoided this place for a long time because the first thing I had there, their chicken burrito, didn't taste like much. (I still don't recommend it.) My only general complaint is that some of the meats just don't have a lot of flavor. I almost never order carne asada so I can't recall if it's good. But the carnitas and the fish are reliably tasty. The food is definitely consistent. There are also a lot of menu items I simply haven't tried due to my aforementioned burrito obsession. Overall, it's a good value and a decent burrito just a few blocks from home, so I'll keep coming back.
author: Jason G.

description: Great place to get Mexican food on Polk! The chips are super thin and amazing. Every time I come here, I leave happy :)
author: Lauren N.

description:
I would have given them 2 stars if they would have remembered to offer me chips. From the outside it looked inviting so decided to go inside. 
Let's get straight to the point. Their food tastes like air. If you can imagine what the color white mite taste like, its this. The rice quite literally tastes like soft air. The enchiladas also shared the same memorable taste of air. The steak tacos weren't too bad though. And the beans topped with fresh cheese leave a nice after taste of air. And the napkins were far away too.
author: Daneia R.

description: Yo this place used to be semi decent but this new working at the cash register ruined my whole prefer and my lunch. After driving over from Hayes valley traffic to get a decent burrito they give me the wrong order and tried to sell me some watermelon juice the new is pretty much weird af he needs to work somewhere else not a taqueria the old guy was way cooler I mean if could give zero starts this is it!!
author: Jen L.

description: Awesome steak and shrimp burrito, cool BBQ style burrito. Cool vibe inside, nice salsa bar
author: Andrew K.

description:
If you don't mind a 20 minutes wait for your burrito this is the place for you.

It kinda defeats the purpose of getting a burrito.
author: Soheil Y.

description: The salsa bar offers three to four options and none are all that spicy. Even the "hot" salsa is pretty mild but it does have a nice smoky chipotle flavor. The handmade corn tortillas are great as is the chicken used for the chicken tacos. The tacos come with a big dallop of guacamole (score I love guacamole). The tacos were great. The rice and beans were just ok. You get salsa and chips with your order and you definitely don't walk away from your meal with even a little room in your tum left. I have mixed feelings about this place. I might give it another try.
author: Lyndsay M.

description:
I used to really like Panchos's - great neighborhood Mexican restaurant with tasty home cooking. I was a regular but never again after today. I placed an order in the phone, took a Lyft to pick up the food. I paid cash for a $50 order and tipped the gentleman generously! I asked him to make sure that all the items on my order were in the bag. I took a Lyft back home and found a missing item.

I called Pancho's and the guy who answered the phone took absolutely no responsibility. He stated that he couldn't help me as he just clocked in and wasn't the guy that took my order or gave it to me. He said that if I came back to the restaurant, he would get me the missing item. Wow - incredible customer service!!

You just lost a regular!
author: Viv A.

description: The service was great and the food was originally crafted in house. The food itself tasted excellent and authentic and it was a great atmosphere for the flavor.
author: Matt K.

description: This was a cool place to come to on a Sunday night. My food was delicious! I highly recommend the chicken and steak fajitas. They were the bomb.com. I wish they would open a location in my city. I will definitely be making a stop back here the next time I am in San Francisco.
author: Victoria E.

description:
UPDATE: Pancho's customer service is much improved, so upping my rating.

Dear Panchos,

I like your food, but will no longer be patronizing your restaurant, since your telephone customer service is so lousy. 

Every time - and I do mean every time - I call to place a takeout order, the conversation goes exactly the same way:

You: Hi, Pancho's on Polk St, how can I help you?
Me: Hi, I'd like to place an order to go: a chicken burracho burrito, no chips. 
You: Can you hold on please? 
(few minutes later after dealing with customers in line)
You (same person): Hi, Pancho's on Polk St, how can I help you?

Please. Please. If you're not in any way ready to help me when you answer the phone, simply say "Can you hold please?" and come back when you are. Every other restaurant in the city has this down, so I'm sure you can do it too.   

I'm going to try to again in a few months, and will update this review with my results.
author: Nick C.

description:
Busy as always .. But it's worth the wait!!!
I had a vegan burrito! They have fresh ingredients and you get to see how they prepare your comida!!
author: Enrique R.

description:
If you think I'm going to say this is one of those hole in the wall Mexican restaurants that has awesome food, then you would be right!

It seems like enough people know about it that "hole in the wall" might not be the proper term anymore, but it is small in terms of size and only having one person working out front, has that authentic feel rather than Americanized Chipotle, and is pretty easy to miss - luckily, my lack of 20/20 vision doesn't hamper my good eye for yummy Mexican food.

I initially was sucked in when I saw the bar - the salsa bar! I love tomatoes and salsa. The pico de gallo here was amazingly fresh and perfectly spiced. Even better, you can just get a whole pint to go for $3.25! Pico is usually expensive so what a deal. There were verde and hot salsas. I would rate all highly on the salsa scale (on deliciousness, not spiciness). Although, the hot salsa did have a kick! I didn't get the guac, but it looked super fresh.

Offerings: Typical authentic Mexican fare...but wait! They have vegetarian burrito...filled with not oily disgusting veggies, but steamed veggies. And my favorite veggie of all - squash. So burritos, tacos, salads, tortilla soup...just imagine typical Mexican fare and you've basically imagined the menu.


Prices: Prices here are super reasonable. Portions are large. 

Service: As with your usual hole in the wall, lots of people were in line and only two people were in the kitchen. Be prepared to wait a little to order and for your food. 

So Pancho's (Salsa Bar and Grill). Not only do you deliver on the "salsa bar" promise, but the taste as well. (insert upside down Spanish exclamation mark here) Ole!
author: Libby J.

description: Mediocre food (and overpriced guacamole). Unfortunately it's one of the only Mexican food places in the area, as opposed to all the awesome spots in the Mission. They do have a salsa bar you can use, but overall don't enjoy going here very much.
author: Roxie B.

description: The atmosphere was good but the meat was really dey
author: Grace N.

description: I wouldn't recommend at all. They have no good customer service at all. Very serious all the time. I ordered a torta and it was supper soggy. My friends plate was super hot yet the food wasn't. Obviously, microwaved. Will not recommend, nor ever go again.
author: Griselda M.

description: Decent burrito good salsa bar only a 3 STar review due to my SOl Beer being $6!!??? Shouldn't complain to much since norm at a bar but this isnt a bar..
author: Jay A.

description: Best Mexican chicken soup I've had at a restaurant. Very authentic and healthy/homemade. Really good salsa selection too. Staff is friendly and atmosphere is pretty chill. Great little restaurant
author: Cassandra C.

description: I eat here about once a month when I am in the area for work.  It's inexpensive, reasonably fast, seems clean and has a good salsa bar.  The food is definitely on the bland side.  While it wouldn't survive in the Mission, on the upper "nicer" side of Polk Street, it is a good value and very dependable.  The very thin chips are tasty and horchata is good.  Then you can walk down a few doors and get a few Bob's doughnuts to take home.
author: S. D.

description:
OK - I like the food and the staff they are nice people...  They are a bit tight with the salsa (only have 1/4 oz plastic cups for it) OK maybe an ounce just to be fair...

I'd give them more stars except they charge tooooo much for a soda with your meal.

I recently got a sausage burrito and was shocked when I found I paid almost $3 for a large soda - hey gang this is way too much.  This place is fine for a neighborhood taco joint but it ain't Gary Danko so they should not be charging five star prices for a large glass of soda.

If you aren't on a hipster salary or just don't want to waste your money ask for a glass of tap water instead and get several of those plastic salsa cups so you get a teaspoon worth of it...
author: Dalt W.

description:
Great happy hour beer specials! Order your burrito with less rice and beans and double meat. It's pricier but worth it.
The Carnitas and Asada Rock.
author: Mark B.

description: BEWARE!!  Tons of roaches!  Disgusting.  The guy behind the counter super rude.  Gives me crap for taking more than the apparent approved tiny cups of salsa.  A hole, I get a burrito without meat, although you charge me for it.  Think maybe that's worth a couple tablespoons of salsa?  Spend nearly $20 on a bean/cheese burrito and some chips (which they charge EXTRA for) and you can't look the other way for a little extra salsa?  Salsa Bar (don't take more than a tablespoon or two or we threaten to charge you) and Grill (free roaches). The place never has any customers inside.  Maybe it's because the place is gross and the counter minimum wage guy thinks he can treat customers like crap.  Or the fact it's in a neighborhood with nothing but street bums.  My car got broken into and the cops told me it's notorious for that. BTW popular hospital nearby that USED to go here will  be boycotting me as well.  Can't wait til Trump builds the wall.
author: Lynne P.

description:
Service is slow. I have an hour lunch and my order took 40 minutes for just a burrito and fajitas. One customer walked out angry with his order due to him waiting so long. They didn't even offer chips for us to munch on while waiting (which most taquerias give you in the meantime). The cashier seems confused with the orders as well. The cashier and cooks could use better communication and flow. I can't even enjoy my meal anymore because I only have 10 mins to eat. 

Don't make a hungry person angry!
author: Maellene D.

description:
Authentic Mexican food served here! 

I got the combination plate of two steak tacos. Freshly homemade tortillas with NO fat in my steak pieces and tasty guacamole... Yum! It was delicious! 

Recommending to my SF goers :)
author: Marie P.

description: Was walking around town with a few friends that were from out of town. This place caught our eye and decided to check it out. It was one of those restaurants where you walk up and place your order and wait for your number to be called. Seating was decent and the decor was pretty neat to take a gander at. It did take a bit longer for my order to come out while everyone ordered theirs at the same time (paid all together pretty much). Well, got to say that the wait was worth it. Had the bowl of Sopa De Pollo. Veggies were perfectly cooked where it melts in your mouth. Potatoes did the same and the rice at the bottom weren't overcooked (just right). Prices were pretty average (more or less a tad bit more since I live up in North Bay Area so totally understand the price difference between a bigger city and one that's a bit smaller), but worth it for some authentic Mexican dishes. Will most definitely come back whenever I'm back in the area.
author: Steve B.

description:
Worst breakfast burrito on earth and it cost $7.  Picture attached. 

It was mostly rice, one disgusting sausage that was fried and smashed up, and a tiny bit of scrambled egg. The sausage was not a breakfast sausage but a spicy polish sauasage. No cheese or sour cream or avocado. To dry to be able to eat. It was also more smushed together than wrapped. 

Also it took 20 minutes to make and I was the one one in the restaurant. When I asked how much longer i was told that it takes 15 minutes because they have to make it from scratch. I don't think it takes 15 minutes to fry an egg. He was really rude to me in how he told me. 

Not worth buying at any price.
author: reza n.

description:
Food is so good but only three stars cuz is no enough people working there, in busy time you need to wait a lot!! I know they want to save money but they sacrifices the quality of services!! 
I was working in restaurants and for experience I know this issue and is really bad overwhelme the persons working, never the services in your place is gonna be good!! That problem is not talking good about managers and owners!!
author: Arturo R.

description:
My homegirl and I (mainly just me actually) were hankerin for some Mexican food. She yelped a bunch of places nearby and came to the conclusion on panchos. I didn't really like the name of it personally, sounded to me like one of those taquerias down south that's made by a bunch of white dudes who would prefer French fries in their burritos. But we walked in and found it was the real deal, with some funny decorations on the wall that all fit the atmosphere.

I pretty much always order enchilada plates wherever I go for Mexican food. But something caught my eye this time. Hand made tamales. It didn't matter what else I read, I knew my decision was already made. My homegirl got the fish tacos, which also had handmade tortillas. Both plates were delicious, but the tamales were the real fucking deal. So moist and delicious pork inside. And it came with this green salsa on the side of the plate that is simply fantastic. Tremendous plates.

The salsa bar is pretty good, I was expecting more for it being made multiple times daily. Pico was good, the green salsa was a bit sub par, kinda watery but I'm gonna chalk it up to being like 10pm when we walked in. The red salsa had to have been one of the hottest salsas I've tried at a Mexican restaurant, most places don't even offer shit this spicy.
author: Jim B.

description:
You know what? Pancho's really grew on me. To be honest, I didn't like it all that much the first time but subsequent return visits have made me appreciate it more and more. 

So the first experience was mediocre... just something inauthentic feeling about shredded processed cheese tossed on top of a taco. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7qSq-m4LRu3PAfroD-LKJg?select=6Y4lSsH-43K89Ub5JCGxEQ#MclQEhVMXorlnld2PiozbA) With that said, the carnitas are really moist and flavorful here though. That's my go-to meat of choice here. I often get the carnitas in a small burrito which is large enough for me plus it's a perfect beer mop for an afternoon of drinks on Polk. The fried fish tacos here are pretty yummy too. Look out for drink specials on the board especially early in the week. I've had $2 Anchors here before. 

Service is friendly and they get the food out to you quick. A quick stop at the salsa bar for some creamy salsa verde, fresh tomato salsa, and you are good to go. While the first meeting was mediocre, I'm glad to say Pancho's has grown to become a favorite pre/post drink tortilla fix on Polk for me.
author: Jon L.

description: I've had the quesadillas, burritos, steak and shrimp tacos. The steak tacos are by far my favorite - the rest are okay. The tortilla is what really makes the tacos taste great (along with some salsa from the salsa bar).
author: Jerrin B.

description: I called and asked If I could place an order for delivery and was immediately hung up. No worries, there are plenty of other restaurants around that deliver better Mexican food.
author: Allan W.

description:
Usually enjoy panchos, nice people, good ingredients. 

However today I watched them bang utensils on the trash and immediately use them to spoon food for customers not just once but multiple times, it was to empty the stuff stuck to the utensil.  They were also eating and dipping something while cooking, without gloves and without washing between putting things in their mouths.  It's not horrible but it doesn't make me feel good that the rest of the kitchen processes are sanitary.

Happy to adjust my rating if management put a new policy in place.
author: Jason A.

description:
Food 
Chicken burrito with all the fixings - yum purdy good

Service 
Yay accepts card. Order pickup at counter. Nice people 

Atmosphere 
Festively Mexican
author: Angela L.

description: Service was bad,they forgot my husban drink and my kids quesadilla,and they never apologies for that
author: Alejandra H.

description:
Let me make it easy for you. Forget the lengthy reviews. 

You've got a sweet tooth with a love of spice. Get the Borracho. 

If you're fancy and don't like spice and like feeling fancy with a plastic knife and dork. Get the green chili enchiladas. 

If you don't like Mexican food. GTFO. 

Ask for free chips.
author: Joe N.

description:
The four stars come half from pretty good food, and half from excellent price. Any delicious food under $8 in this city is a steal.

The fajitas are fresh and flavorful. The corn tortillas taste just like the ones from trader joes, if you know what I'm talking about.

The buracho burrito had a sweet and spicy sauce that was a pleasant surprise with the first bite.
author: Ashley E.

description: Panchos was very delicious! There mahi-mahi fish tacos where amazing! My boyfriend had the mahi mahi burrito and it was Devine. The customer service was great! Would definitely come back and try there shrimp tacos!
author: Monica H.

description: I ordered a chicken quesadilla for takeout here and was super happy with everything. The food was ready quickly and the price was perfect. Also super good tortilla chips. Will def be back :)
author: Jason S.

description:
I don't think 4 salsa's constitute a "salsa bar"
I live close by so I was really hoping this place would be good. But-
Bad service with mediocre food. Had the "steak burrito" although it had very little steak (3 pieces) It did have a lot of retried beans. Service took too long for lunch. And the cook was walking around like she had nothing to do, and there where 8 tickets in the window! It was a busy lunch and both cooks took time to get themselves a soda when they could see customers waiting for their orders. No love and it shows in their food. 
The only good thing I can say is the chips were good. 
Wish I would had read the reviews first. Next time it's Nicks Tacos or the Mission.
author: Leland L.

description: I went to this restaurant with my girlfriend. She ordered the veggie atomic burrito, neither one of us eat meat. While she was eating her vegetarian burrito she found a piece of meat in it. I decided I didn't want to make a big deal about it because it was just one piece, but I thought it would be a good thing to just let the staff know so they could be more conscious. I went to the counter with the piece of meat and politely told the woman behind the register that we found a piece of meat and just wanted to let them know so the kitchen could be more careful. A few minutes later as I was throwing out my trash I heard her speaking to the two cooks in Spanish (I'm fluent in Spanish) and she is basically talking shit and making fun of the fact that I told her about the piece of meet and then all three of them turn around and laugh. I know people in the food industry have to deal with customers complaining and annoying in general but in this case when it is a dietary restriction and I was polite about it, I find it very uncalled for that the staff acted the way they did. I will not be returning.
author: Hannah O.

description:
Pancho's is a great spot for some quick and relatively cheap eats in Nob Hill. This place is super clean, but not fancy. The decor is kitschy and fun. They have an assortment of Mexican beers and a couple of single serving bottles of wine in the fridge. The tacos and fajitas are basically the same, but fajitas portion is smaller and comes with guacamole. Order the Tacos if you are looking at both. Tortillas are made in house and are delicious!

The staff spoke just enough English to understand our orders and were very accommodating. 

Don't forget to ask for free chips with your order. The salsa bar is rockin.
author: Joshua I.

description: Had a great experience eating here. The food was fresh, the steak in my tacos wasn't too salty. The salsa bar is frequently replenished, clean and bomb. The décor is kitschy but great. The whole restaurant is very clean.
author: Molly C.

description: Came here on two separate occasions. First time I ordered a chicken burrito. The flavors just weren't there for me and the ingredients just didn't taste fresh. The second time I ordered a combination plate which included two tacos (1 chicken/1steak) along with beans and rice. All I really enjoyed on the plate were the beans and rice. The tacos were each on an extremely thick soft tortilla and again, my food didn't taste fresh. On both occasions the meat was extremely dry as if it was cooked hours before. 2 times here is enough for me.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
I like Pancho's. Delicious tacos...tortillas made from fresh corn... mmm

Prices are fair, convenient choices (tacos, burritos, etc) but I do wonder the freshness. The fish tacos and meat tacos aren't nearly as mouth-watering as some of the other gems around the city.

However, for Polk, this is the spot!
author: Veronica S.

description: They need to change the hours posted outside their door. I live in the neighborhood and walk by all the time yet have never been. On Friday night after having a few drinks I figured a burrito would be the perfect treat. I was pretty hungry and I remembered that Panchos stayed open till 12:00, so when I arrived at 11:00 I was not a happy camper when they said they were closed. Change the hours posted so you don't make more people hangry.
author: Claire B.

description: Burrito came out with a brittle tortilla, burrito that was supposed have guacamole turns out to have no guac. Taste wise and presentation not worth the wait.
author: Garrick L.

description:
This place used to be a go-to Mexican restaurant in the neighborhood (with no contenders). I've been living in the neighborhood for 20 yrs and I must say this restaurant went all down hill. I'd rather go to chipotle! 
I ordered the steak and shrimp burrito. The burrito lacked flavor and moisture. The burrito was dry and not really fresh. I was unsatisfied with my burrito. It's been a full day and my stomach is still traumatized by the burrito.THIS PLACE GAVE ME THE RUNS : / DO NOT GO!!!
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
food: good
Place: lots of Mexican decoration
Recommendation: get a quick bite and keep partying
author: Marcelo D.

description: OMG! I just had the best fish tacos in my whole LIFE!! Safe to say I can die a happy man now!! I totally recommend  this place if you like authentic Mexican.
author: Ponchin L.

description:
Been going here for over 10 years and it's consistently been a good semi fast food Mexican place my favorite are the cheese enchiladas with rice and beans the staff changes times but recently I've had the pleasure of being served by Malinda she was incredible!  
 she manage to keep the entire restaurant coverd when I was there
author: John C.

description: Legit mexican food in a city that lost its culture.. My first time trying this place suggested by a m8. I got the steak and shrimp burrito and might i add i was not let down. Decent sized burrito and fairly priced which is seldom in sf. Not the most flavor ive experienced in a burrito but not bland either. If im in the area i will be going back again and likely trying a taco of each sort. I recommend that for any mexican establishment to know what their strong points are. One thing that i disliked was the layout of the burrito. Steak and shrimp however i didnt get both in each bite. It was literally segregated like a mississippi high school in the 60s. Top half shrimp then bottom half steak to where i questioned if i ordered steak in my burrito until i reached the halfway point. I wont deduct a point just a tip they should consider
author: Eltroy J.

description: I've never been disappointed coming here.  Their salads are great, their meat is flavorful and juicy and did I mention they make their own tortillas?  Oh and that they serve breakfast all day?  Mmmmm breakfast for lunch......
author: Stephanie M.

description:
What a great find for filling, yummy, inexpensive burritos!

I managed to feed nearly 60 people on a production crew with the awesome burritos and tortilla chips from this place.

Abel took my order and make sure everything was prepared correctly and labeled perfectly. 

Their chips & salsa are amazing!

Everyone got plenty to eat and left the craft service table happy and ready for some more work.  

We will be back.
author: Wendy P.

description: I like that Pancho's offers some different burritos, like one with fried plantains, as well as having pupusas.  Burrito was 7/10 though, and salsa leaves a bit to be desired.  Wait was longer than expected for to go burrito.
author: Ben S.

description: Been going here for years. Just our go-to for good Mexican food. I always get the carnitas tacos and my husband gets the burrito, usually whatever is their special of the day.
author: Jillian M.

description: Loved the homemade tortillas on the tacos. Hot salsa is hot! But the salsas are kind of bland. I loved the atmosphere and the staff was very friendly.
author: Michaela W.

description: I used to love this place. But they've gotten cheaper and cheaper. The menu says the magi Mahi Mahi tacos come with avocado salsa. When they said they don't have avocado salsa, I asked for sliced avocado. Then they charged me. I've also recently had to argue to get chips. And it's FREEZING in there--and they employees just don't care, they keep opening that huge window above the door that acts as a wind tunnel. They also serve store bought packaged shredded cheese and cut corners with serving microscopic amounts of guacamole on their plates. So sad that after 15 years of being a good and loyal customer, I won't be going back.
author: matthew d.

description:
I'm stunned such a mediocre Mexican restaurant can exist in San Francisco. This reminds me of the Mexican food I've had in rural Nevada on road trips. I ordered a super carnitas burrito (my standard) got big slices of unripe tomatoes, iceberg lettuce, cheddar cheese, unseasoned carnitas, poorly wrapped burrito. Chips and salsa were okay? Idk 

I guess all the fratty tech bros who live in Polk Gulch/Russian Hill think this spot is great but holy shit I haven't had such a bad burrito in awhile.
author: Max J.

description: Meat in the burrito was super dry. Not too many alternatives for Mexican food in this neighborhood. It'll get the job done if that's what you're craving and don't want to go far.
author: Sean S.

description: 20 minutes for a steak burrito that takes 5 minutes every where else. The couple in front of me also looked really annoyed that their order was taking forever. Wasn't even crowded, just those 2 orders and mine.
author: Tinou B.

description: Hidden gem. You don't need to go to the Mission for great Mexican food, it's right here!
author: Joseph A.

description: If you're in the mood for super casual Mexican this is a solid choice. They have a great salsa bar and the prices are super reasonable. Always order the beans and rice with your entree. It's really tasty.
author: Yasi N.

description:
Super unfriendly counter person
Disgusting burrito..barely any meat..totally flavorless and unripe tomatoes and avacado....I don't know why I give this place my money....continuously bad!
author: Nicholas F.

description:
I really, really like Pancho's. And I have for many, many years. So this review is very, very overdue.

Pretty standard menu - and perfect sized burritos. Not giant bricks you'll regret eating an hour later yet also not small by any means. I love that they offer spinach or whole wheat flour tortillas - I'm all about the healthy and Pancho's makes it easy to enjoy Mexican food on the healthier side. Yummy pork, steak, chicken, or mahi-mahi for protein filling plus all the other fun stuff like guac, pico de gallo, etc.

Always service with a smile. Always. Mucho gracias mi amigos de Pancho's.
author: Meredith R.

description: This place gets a bad rap but they cook up decent Mexican cuisine. Whether you're looking for good carnitas tacos or a chicken mole plate to go, this spot has you covered. The green salsa is amazing, and the tortillas are homemade. That's about all you need to know.
author: Eric M.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE. I'm a local here in the Russian Hill area and my housemates introduced me to Pancho's. We'd come here on Saturdays to eat great Mexican with a pitcher of beer. But, no more. A restaurant with a vengeful staff is not a place you want to eat.

I ordered my usual enchiladas, and I guess the girl heard me wrong(?). When my plate arrived, it was tamales. She insisted I ordered tamales. I apologized and said that no, I ordered enchiladas. I even went up to the front desk, said I'm sorry again and offered to pay the price difference, which I did. I gave them a tip. Based on the looks I got from the staff in the kitchen, they looked upset. She asked me if I wanted green sauce. I corrected her and said, I'd like red. She said green again. I corrected her again. She said the meal would be ready in 10 mins.

When the food arrived, it was covered in green sauce. Really? I figured I'd not make more issues and just eat it. Then I was shocked to find that the entire plate was covered in really, really hot sauce. Seriously? I've eaten here plenty of times and they never put hot sauce on everything. They want me to never eat here again, they made that message clear. And I'll be sure no one I know ever does either. Go to Taqueria Z on Columbus.
author: A. G.

description:
I have eaten here a few times already but most recently this week and I can't wait to go back. Ordered the chicken enchiladas and they were tasty/filling -- entree includes rice & black beans. Also got a free side of chips and all the salsa you want.

The hot salsa is uncomfortably hot so I couldn't handle more than my first bite without blowing out my taste buds. 

Will eat here again (and again). My new go-to place for chicken enchiladas (my fave) although want to try other things like their steak fajitas.
author: D L.

description:
Big Price...Small Burrito...
for what i paid i would expect twice what i got.

this place would do if i absolutely had to but i wouldn't go out of my way!
author: Ripley B.

description: Chicken and pork tamales are good - they don't skimp on the filling. Their chicken and steak burritos are good too. Very fresh ingredients, good quality meat with few fat pieces. Burritos are large and very filling. Can never finish a whole burrito, so only eat half for lunch and save the other half for dinner.
author: Elaine L.

description:
I got the shrimp atomic burrito. Not the most flavorful burrito in fact bland may be the best describer but it was huge & nice on the wallet. I guess if you're a size queen or like quantity over quality this joint is for you. 

Salsa bar ehhh not enough spice, even the jalapeños were bland. 

Service was courteous and efficient. The cashier brought over some extra chips for us, that was nice. 

Doubt I'll be back.
author: Jade W.

description:
I don't know how these guys do it, but they make the best damn bean & cheese burrito I have ever had...next to El Indio in San Diego. They may seem a little confused at first (for some reason ordering burrito without rice is weird in SF. In socal, it's the opposite. Get the filler out of my burrito!), but stand your ground!

They would have gotten 5 stars, but I must mention that I ordered a shrimp quesadilla and it was rather disappointing. There was a decent amount of shrimp, but it was really lacking in the cheese department...making it a rather sorry quesadilla. And shrimp ain't cheap to order!

While I won't be ordering that again, they've got me hooked on the ol B & C burritos, and they have a super cheap ($10-$12, I recall?) beer pitcher & jalapeno poppers special I would really like to try.
author: Katie S.

description:
Love that veggie burrito it's delicious!
Plus they're registered in my airline program so I get miles everytime I go, win!
author: Ajay T.

description:
I go to this Mexican place for a while now, because the food is really good and the services is fast. I'm used to go at night, but today I decided to have lunch there for the first time. 
What a horrible experience. The place was packed and the guy that works there was really rude with me in front of everyone. 
I wanted to get the Combination #3 that comes with cheese quesadilla, a small burrito and guacamole. I asked him what comes inside the cheese quesadilla because every Mexican restaurant does its dishes in a different way. So instead of answering my simple question, he replied with "what you just said? What is the kind of quesadilla you just said?". And I asked him again "what comes inside of the cheese quesadilla?". And for my surprise he relied "you've just said cheese, right? What do you think that comes inside of it?" 
WHAT? Was that real? So I told him I DO know what cheese is and that I just wanted to know if the quesadilla comes with anything else inside, specially because I am sensitive to certain foods. And after I said that he completed with: "do you see anything else written there? So NO" 
That was the meanest thing that have ever happened to me on a restaurant.
So I yelled at him saying he was REALLY RUDE and left the place. I will never come back to that place again. They just lost a customer that goes there at least once a week!
author: Fernanda D.

description:
Situation:
Burrito to go on a Friday evening

The Good
- The restaurant itself was spacious

The Bad
- The Chicken Burrito was very bland.  They must steam their tortilla's like Chipotle, because it sure wasn't right.
author: Dipesh G.

description:
As often as I've walked past this place it recently dawned on me that I had never stopped in for a bite.  Pancho's is located just a few storefronts from Bob's Donut, and if you follow my reviews you know that I go to Bob's religiously.  I was in the neighborhood for yet another donut craving (now it's the jelly ones!) so I figured why go home and cook?  I decided to grab a donut or two anyways for dessert then headed over to Pancho's for dinner.

The interior inside this restaurant is very festive with all sorts of trinkets hanging on its walls (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7qSq-m4LRu3PAfroD-LKJg?select=NQXFjOyDIAczDC8jOBUSDA).  Let's face it, if you go inside and you're feeling really bored studying these walls, looking at the trinkets and reading all the unique signs will alleviate any symptoms of boredom.  At least that was the case for me.

You order at the counter and your food is brought to you.  That was my case.  I noticed later with other patrons that their number was called and they had to go to the counter to get their food.  Either method works for me.  If there's food waiting to be eaten I'll get to it one way or another.

I ordered the chicken enchiladas with the mild red sauce.  I had eaten a chicken burrito with spicy green sauce from another restaurant earlier that day and the fiery green sauce was still wreaking havoc in the background.  Pancho's mild red sauce is tasty and very, very mild with just a hint of chiles.  My chicken enchiladas (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/7qSq-m4LRu3PAfroD-LKJg?select=U4yl_-SieUH_JMR6EthRpQ) were ready with very little wait.  The enchiladas are served with rice and black beans and garnished with a little shredded lettuce, a sprig of cilantro, a single tortilla chip and a piece of radish.  A shredded cheese mix of cheddar and jack cheeses was melted on top of the enchiladas but not the beans.  I would have preferred the cheese be melted on the beans also. You can heap salsa onto your food at your own discretion at the restaurant's salsa bar.

The enchiladas were stuffed with lots of white meat chicken.  The chicken meat was moist but quite bland in taste absorbing only the taste of the mild red sauce.  The homemade cornmeal tortillas were also too thick for my preference.  I would have liked a thinner tortilla.  The rice had a very subtle seasoning in it but much of it was clumped together.  That kind of reminded me of eating leftover rice.  The black beans were good.

While filling the enchiladas really weren't what I had hoped for.  I'll be back on another night to try something else from the menu.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I would give them another star if not for the weird service. It seems that every time I come here, which is not often because of this reason, I get the woman who cashiers only until she reached me and then all of a sudden, she turned into...a server, a bus person, delivery person, etc. 

For example, on my last visit which was yesterday, she stopped taking order when it became my turn, and told me, "just a minute" and then started running around and do stuff like refilling the salsa bar, get ice, deliver food to the tables, getting this from the kitchen, that into the kitchen, etc. And then finally, when she's back behind the counter, I thought she was going to take my order, but nooo...she started doing something else again. So another lady from the kitchen came over and started taking orders because now the line is getting really long.

If they are so busy, why don't they hire another person? Anyway, aside from that, I find them ok nice but weird. If it wasn't for the fact that I was craving Mexican food, I would have walked out because I am a bit impatient. Food is not bad which is what makes me go back even with the weirdness.
author: Missy X.

description:
This restaurant is fun inside. I got the chicken burrito and it was so moist and tasty. I love the homemade tortilla! What a difference that makes in your burrito experience.

One burrito was plenty to share between my sister and I, and was the perfect snack before heading into red devil lounge. 

Also a plus that we have something relatively close, so if you can't hit up the Mission, this is the next best thing.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
The food: have been eating here for years and everything tastes good. Not great, and not super authentic in terms of flavor. However, and as a result, it is not greasy and is really easy on the stomach. The salsas are fresh and provide plenty of flavor.

The ambiance: it's a hole in the wall, but the wall decorations are kitchy, and it's very clean. This isn't a "cultural experience" type of place, instead more of grab a burrito / torta and go for the locals, which is just fine.

Service: good service. Fast and efficient.

Overall, this is a solid local place. Good quality ingredients and a good value. For a more authentic Mexican experience probably should go to the Mission, but frankly, I am of the opinion that Mexican food in SF isn't all that good. Need to go to So Cal for that.
author: Oleg A.

description:
Service and atmosphere were great- owners seemed very nice and accommodating. Salsa bar looked fresh and had lots of great variety. The other reviewers are correct in saying the food here is indeed a bland without any additions. I would expect the rice and beans to be seasoned well enough that this wouldn't be a problem, however!

I ordered a steak burrito which came with chips on the side. The steak was tough and didn't taste fresh. There was not anything interesting to note on the other components of the burrito. I added fresh pico and the hottest salsa to the burrito (both were delicious and flavorful!), which helped enhance the taste. All in all still convenient and cheap comfort food!
author: Vicki S.

description:
Panchos - a neighborhood favorite and has been around for a very long time.

Occasionally I hit Panchos up when I am craving some authentic Mexican goodness.  What I love most about Panchos is their tortillas, they are hand-made, and are simply delish - I don't think I've ever had tortillas made this tasty,  and in every item on the menu you can really taste the fresh ingredients put in to make the tasty items.  

I highly recommend the daily specials, as they are always a hit.  

Case in point:

The other day during the lunch hour, I made a special trek to Panchos and was so happy to see something different on the daily specials menu.  

It was their Tijuana Tacos and they are not your average Tijuana tacos.  The ingredients included tender steak fajita, sautéed sweet peppers, roasted potatoes, chipotle sauce, fresh cilantro and pico de gallo.  I am sure I am missing something, but God those tacos succulent and delicious.  Writing this review, I am craving them right now.  

Here is a little insight and is something I've learned over the years; don't be in a rush, especially during the lunch hour.  The ladies, God bless them, who cook in the kitchen tend to be on the slow side and do a lot, and I mean a LOT of gossiping (I understand a little (pico) Spanish).  And they are quite humorous in their discussions; but not on days when I am in a rush (like weekdays during my lunch hour).  

So due to my assessment, I have devised a different strategy in that I order and pay, then head out to make use of the time and do other errands in the hood.  I come back 15 minutes later and Voila! My lunch is ready and I am on my way back to work.  

My only gripe is sometimes they forget (and I should know better by now) to complete the order, that is, if you order something outside of the norm, say a side dish of rice and beans, sometimes they forget to include these items in your to-go bag.  

So this is something I need to keep in mind when ordering - before leaving check my bag to make sure I received everything I ordered.  8^)
author: Cris B.

description: Delicious fajitas and burritos! Fresh and authentic. Homemade tortillas and great salsa! Highly recommend.
author: Nitzan S.

description:
For its location, the food is well priced, filling and satisfactory. Nice decorations, comfortable atmosphere. I like the double standard too. Good family place during the day, and also good for a night out. The salsa bar is there for a good reason, take advantage of that. 

Burritos are good if you're super hungry
Tamales and enchiladas are my top 2 recommendations if you're really in the mood to sit down and savor the taste of Mexico. (Hint; add a little red chile sauce to your tamales = heaven)

my all-time number one fave is the chicken mole. i was scared to try it at first but once i finally did i couldn't get enough of it !
author: Lena E.

description:
This is one of my go-to restaurants on Polk Street. I've been a long-time fan and have been coming here for over a decade. The food is always made-to-order and the salsas are always freshly made. The watermelon agua fresca is a great addition to your meal as it is incredibly delicious and refreshing. 

I've been pretty much tried everything and enjoyed them all.
author: K. E.

description: I've been coming here for years, it's a very convenient spot from my apartment. They have really tasty salsas and I dig their cheese enchiladas and burritos. I actually ordered those delicious enchiladas last week, and was surprised when I got them home that they had made me shrimp enchiladas ( I can't eat shrimp, problem!). When I called to let them know of this dilemma they remade my order ASAP, and as far as I can tell were very understanding. We all make mistakes once in a blue moon,but rectifying the situation the way they did was very professional and kind.
author: Mary S.

description: Very tasty borracho burrito - ask for no rice and you will be surprised! Portion size is perfect, and the spicy salsa is very spicy!
author: Jared B.

description:
The staff is nice and the decor is fun.

The food tastes like cardboard, the best choice is to go to the salsa bar and pile on the spices for flavor. I had the chicken enchilada, it was awful. This isn't my first time here either so I know it wasn't a fluke, I tired it almost a year ago when it opened (because I LOVE Mexican food - I could eat it the rest of my life, if it didn't make me fat). My roommate, boyfriend, and self have unanimously decided this place is not so good. Which makes me sad because it's basically at my doorstep. Muy triste.
author: Jenna P.

description:
After biking all day through San Francisco on the way to the Golden Gate, we stumbled on to this establishment and it definitely hit the spot. 

This isn't a place you would go for the ambience or for a celebration, but the food was very fresh and tasty. I got the Sopa de Pollo, and must say that it is some of the best chicken soup I have ever had in the world. I am not kidding. The balance of flavors from the fresh corn tortilla, the sliced avocado on top and the lime and cilantro was to die for. I will definitely hit this spot again on my next trip to SF.
author: Devalina G.

description:
Came into Pancho's last night to a packed house! The line was 10 deep around 7:15 PM and the cashier was working her ass off between bringing out the orders and trying to take orders as they only had 1 person working the front and 2 people in the back cooking.

I ordered the Steak Burrito and Baja Shrimp Tacos to go along with a $2 Dos Equis Mug while waiting --- and both the food dishes were on point. The shrimp tacos had just the beer battered fish, light toppings and the tortilla to really bring out the flavor.

My only compliant was that the salsa bar was not full --- however, that issue was not the employees but rather managements lack of staffing.
author: Brian D.

description: Great service at the register and that's about it.  I ordered a super burrito with everything in it and it had no taste.  First and last time I eat at this place.
author: Oscar B.

description: I hate having to give negative reviews but sadly this place deserves one. As a former vegetarian with veggie tendencies I get excited about places that have burritos with veggies and don't consider a veggie burrito beans and cheese so I was excited to try Pancho's. Ordered the veggie burrito (minus cheese). It took forever for my number to be called. Despite ordering it to go I couldn't wait and unwrapped the foil immediately. It was a soggy mess. Tortilla looked like it had been run under water and the whole thing fell apart. I brought it home thinking I'd try to repeat it and maybe try again but it's now in the trash and Pancho's is off my list. And btw, for a place with salsa bar in the title, I expected more than 6 not even good salsas with containers larger than a thimble size.
author: Liz R.

description:
I would give 2 stars if not their $2.50 beer and chips. The borracho chicken burrito was well below average. It seemed like it was put together by somebody with 2 left hands. Inside was a mediocre mix of lots of rice, some chicken, beans. I don't think i tasted sour cream, cheese, or guacamole.

The chips taste great. Salsa bar has like 6 different options, none of them are really great, but OK. 

Over all, I will likely comeback, when I'm drunk, its just not that great when you're sober.
author: Try E.

description: It took longer than I expected for them to make the food and call my number, but this was one of the better burritos I've had in SF. I forgot which item on the menu it was, but it had both barbecue sauce and guac, making for a pretty delicious and unique combination. Everything fell apart when I got to the very last bit of the burrito, but that's what the complimentary wet wipes were for!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
This is an overdue revue.
Came here a few times for burritos and each time was fine.
I've forgotten abut this place for a while, but I've been looking for convenient mexican, and I think I'm going back.... perhaps tomorrow!

Its raining and I don't feel like venturing too far, so I'll take the 1 to Polk, hop off and grab some food from Panchos, then I'm headed home!
author: Ash R.

description:
Clutch place for a burrito on Polk, especially after a long night. I love the atmosphere inside, particularly all the decorations on the walls.

There's a decently large menu to explore, but I went for my go-to; a carnitas burrito. There was something about it that kind of let me down. I had higher hopes for the pork, but it wasn't terrible by any means. My girlfriend had a bean and cheese burrito, which I tried. I thought it was great, but pretty salty. I'm a fan of that--she's not.

Overall, I'd come back here out of convenience, and it not being too shabby. But if I'm in the mood for Mexican, I'll make the trek somewhere else.

tl;rd Good, not great.
author: Tyler H.

description: Authentic Mexican food with amazing service. I love how I can run in here and grab something or sit with friends and have a good time! We live a neighborhood over and it's still worth walking over to get a burrito or two!
author: Lyndsay V.

description: Pancho's is one of the few remaining vestiges of Polk Street from the good old days before yoga pants and cargo shorts mucked up the whole place.  Even Herb Caen was a fan, and anyone should be.  Burritos are more Baja than Mission style so it never ranks among the city's best in all the top tens.  But Pancho's is on upper Polk Street where all the white people live, and Cabo is easier visualized than Cuernavaca.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I ate at several burrito places down on mission. Eating a mission burrito was on my friend from Florida's  bucket list. This place has better burritos than any I've had in the mission. I  visited places that were highly  recommended by travel and leisure and GQ  and they don't compare. The ingredients are all Fresh, the chips are made fresh several times a day. The flour tortillas are soft and delicious but dont fall apart which is saying something because these bad boys are well stuffed. I bought the small burrito and was still pleasantly full I can only imagine what the large would be like. 
All in all its worth skipping the Hype of mission and stopping by Pancho's if you want a good burrito.
If you're a purist you will be disappointed these burritos have rice in them ( they don't use rice in Mexico) But whatever its delicious
author: Luis S.

description: Borracho burrito was bomb!! Had it with carne asada. They use their own Mexican style BBQ which has a nice little kick to it. My girlfriend had the normal carne asada burrito and it was very good too. You can tell they use good quality meat. same goes for their other ingredients.
author: Christopher Z.

description: Service is kinda slow, but I'm guessing they take their time to cook everything just right. You can see the cooks in the kitchen, everything seems pretty authentic & fresh. Nothing beats their shrimp tacos & everything seems fairly priced.
author: Jules F.

description: I go here often because it's nearby. It's no where near the best in the city but it's definitely a great choice in the nob hill area and one of the spots you can always go to for a consistently good burrito as well as some good hot sauces. Stick with the burritos when you order too. They are pretty tasty and better than the other stuff on the menu. Also, the decorations are pretty fun to look at and they have a friendly staff.
author: Gordon Z.

description: Two burritos for less than twenty dollars, fairly quick and really tasty. Good choice for a quick meal in the go. We had the fajita burrito with steak and steak and shrimp burrito and they were both very tasty and filling
author: Sara C.

description:
One thing San Francisco isn't lacking is burrito places. To stand out from the rest, a run-by quick Mexican restaurant has to have going for it is both prices and quality. 

Pancho's isn't the cheapest I've seen for burritos but they made a pretty damn awesome vegetable burrito, the likes I've not quite seen yet. Stuffed full with broccoli, two types of peppers, rice, cheese, beans, salsa and yumminess, it was a pretty damn good treat for me when I was in the process of crashing from no food for most of the day. Due to my decreased appetite I was only able to finish half of the pretty sizable burrito but I could tell that it was a good enough size to fill me for a meal yet not go to waste. Not too big, but not too small. It was JUST RIGHT in size.

Being around the corner from me, I'd be happy to swing by again for more tasty attempts. Three different salsas were available at the free nacho location, but I skipped out on it. My companion tried the "HOT!" salsa (exclamation point was necessary) and found it a very interesting garlic salsa that definitely had some punch.
author: Cassandra J.

description: I really wanted to like this place, it's decor was pretty nice and I hoped for something super authentic and yummy. The staff was friendly, but the food just wasn't all that good. Everything lacked flavor, so the end result was a bit underwhelming. The have sine good salsa though
author: Amaresh S.

description:
I have read majority of the 5 star raters and they questioned why some of us are ranking this place so low. I share the same curiosity to how can they rank this place with 5 stars? For those of you who said you have never tasted any better burrito in the city, my question to you is when was the last time you ventured out to a burrito hunt in the city? My guess is probably 5+ years ago because I can name two places on top of my head where I've tasted better burritos. First of, go to Taco Libre and then come back and tell me Pancho's burrito was just as juicy, just as balanced with their rice/meat ratio, just as tasty salsa at the salsa bar. No offense to Pancho, but their salsa bar need a lot of improvement. I liked how there were a variety and I tried all of them since it was my first time here. Honestly, the only one that I can put in my mouth was the green one (I never know the real salsa names).

I ordered the Borracho and I see more rice than anything else that was listed on the menu. I actually thought they forgot the guacamole, but realize there was one tablespoon worth in the center of the 8in burrito. The staff here is so nice so I have no ill-thoughts toward them and I sincerely wish they can improve on their taste quality. There were only two things that I liked from my experience here, their chips (kudos to the thin and crispy character) and my bottled coca cola.

Probably not going to come back, sorry.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I've been a patron of Pancho's for several years. The food is *usually* very good and prices are okay. Here's where I'd like to see them improve on: 

Sopa de Pollo needs more flavor. It's bulked up on rice, potatoes and vegetables with only one piece of chicken. It's not Sopa de Pollo without the chicken!  

The tostada bowl is very good and generous portions. The grilled steak needs to be served hot, not cold or lukewarm. 

The restaurant is always freezing cold. They leave the windows open 24x7. Seeing that SF is typically cold & foggy, customers don't want to sit & eat a hot meal in a freezing cold restaurant. Do your patrons a favor and close the windows, please... 

Consider adjusting the lighting to make the place a bit more inviting. The bright florescent lighting hurts the dining experience. 

Thanks for reading,
author: Giselle B.

description:
i have been going here since herb caen wrote about it in his article (yes, i am old)

it's always fresh and tasty and the space is always clean

fair prices, hand made food
author: John G.

description: I had a small carnitas burrito. A bit pricey but the place is clean and spacious and the burrito was fresh. The salsa bar offered good variety. It's just a few doors away from the Red Devil Lounge so you can easily stop in between acts.
author: Henry Y.

description: Simple, fresh, and decently priced Mexican food on Polk Street. I occasionally go here when I don't want to walk far from my apartment. Corn tortillas and salsas are all made from scratch. I recommend the chicken tacos.
author: Alya G.

description: First experience was good. Went there two more times after deciding not to return. The service was horrible the last two times and the food we received was a joke. There were fries in a dish that required none. Food was cold due to the time it sat there instead of being served. The only reason I would suggest to go there is probably their drinks.
author: Ana L.

description:
Panchos is my go-to mexican food place in SF. This is in large part due to it's proximity to my house, which requires just a less than 5 minute walk to obtain one of my fave chicken burritos. They are speedy, dependable, and give you free chips and salsa! All good things. 

Get the watermelon agua fresca, it tastes like you stuck a straw in a watermelon. Win.
author: Melinda S.

description:
Thanks to my friend who suggested coming here this past Wednesday evening. I usually go for enchiladas when dining at a Mexican restaurant, and here they had shrimp enchilada as an option. A platter of two goes for $8.99. Not bad.

They also have a good deal on Dos Equis beer: a mug for $1.99 (or I think that was the price). Something good to wash down the enchilada dinner.
author: H K.

description: I come here a ton by myself for lunch and with friends after work! Love the atmosphere and salsa bar. Their combos are really good deals and comes with a ton! Be prepared to feel full when you leave! #mmmmm
author: Monica H.

description: Solid Mexican food served by friendly people.  Good chips and salsas.  Convenient location and the atmosphere is a step up from the usual taqueria.
author: Tom N.

description:
Solid three star Mexican restaurant. Their rice and beans with sour cream, guac burrito is a go-to for me. But, I've actually gotten sick before off of their fish tacos, and their shrimp doesn't quite cook up to what it should be.

Also their salsa bar is a little weak. But the location is clutch and when I used to eat chicken they made a chicken soup that was just out of this world.
author: Paul C.

description: I'm not even going to be ashamed about my love for burritos, or for Panchos, for that matter. Is this the best Mexican food I've ever had? No - but is it a hell of a lot better than the bland food you'll get a few blocks down the street at Nick's? Bingo. My boyfriend and I have been absolutely ADDICTED to Pacho's burritos lately - thanks to the homemade tortillas, delish salsa bar, and likelyyyyy the ridiculously low priced pitchers of beers. I usually go for the chicken burrito, and he's a fan of the atomic with shrimp and steak. Super friendly and quick service, and plenty of chips and salsa to be had while ya wait!
author: Rebecca C.

description: Ordered their carne asada tacos ... so good. Reasonably priced but the meat was dry for my taste. They were open late as I was on my way back to Sac.
