author: Laura G.

description: One of the better taquerias in SF. Pretty simple food, but the ingredients taste fresh and good. It's also not too terribly expensive for Nob Hill food (which is generally outrageously costly).
author: Jason K.

description:
I usually get the Steak and Prawn burrito with extra guacamole.. Yum!!

The grilled Mahi Mahi burrito is good too, but it takes about 15 minutes to make.

minus a star cause it basically comes out to $10.00 without a drink.
author: Angelica C.

description: This place is pretty good in terms of convenience. They always seem to be pretty quick too. I wouldn't say it's astounding. I like the festive decorations but it might be a little much for someone else. They have a cool salsa bar.
author: Olivia C.

description: This place is really good ! Service is amazing ! Love salsa verde and chips are great ! Black beans are super awesome. !
author: Prayank J.

description:
It's really good for a casual meal.  I went with a friend. I had the torta al pastor (Mexican sandwich).  She had their soup and said it was very good.

They also had tamales on the menu.  Yum!  They have a fresh tortilla chips, agua fresca, a fresh salsa bar, and Mexican beer.  Those are all marks of a place trying to be authentic.  

There are better Mexican spots in the city, but if you're in this block and want something good, this is a great choice.
author: Regina W.

description:
Total gringo Mexican.  No flavor - not salty, not spicy, nothing.  Even the "hot" salsa was bland.

Cheap, so if that's all you're looking for it's ok.  Edible.
author: Stacey R.

description: The food here is decent and the prices are reasonable.  The interior is bright and fun and the staff is usually pretty friendly.  It's certainly not the best Mexican food in the area, but overall it's a nice little spot when you are craving some casual, late night Mexican.
author: Riley D.

description: Found this place close to work and surrounded by other places for a quick bite, but should have asked for a recommendation.  I ordered a simple chicken burrito and was a bit disappointed when I seen the size for 8 bucks.  You have to hit home runs with your burritos at any Mexican place even if it's not authentic.  so many places to eat and the competitive nature of restaurants on Polk I will probably think twice before heading in again. Sorry guys.
author: Jason J.

description:
Okay, the food here is awesome, the 3 stars are not reflecting the quality of food in any way, I would give it 5 stars only for the fact my order has been screwed up for the 5th time in 3 months.

I always get a to-go order.
Four times I ordered and paid for a Chicken quesadilla along with a Burrito and four times I get home to find NO chicken in the quesadilla just Cheese?
Since I'm a few blocks from here I just chose to write it off the first 3 times, but not the 4th. Went back to store, complained, nicely I might add, I'm in the service industry too. 
They fixed it with no issues. But really, my printout said Chicken so the kitchen order slip must also say same.
Please start reading the order slips more carefully.

Today I walk in and order a regular Carnitas Burrito and go home & its a Small?
Look at my order slip and it also says Sml, but I never mentioned Small once when ordering.

I know English is not the servers first language, but really, I asked for a Carnitos Burrito, maybe its time to start verifying orders with the customer before sending it to the kitchen.
author: Jack H.

description:
When I moved to Nob Hill I knew I would be giving up convenient, decent taquerias. Or so I thought. Pancho's makes consistently excellent tacos and burritos. Their meat is flavorful and never grisly, and their salsas are good. 

I appreciate the reverence of the "hole in the wall" (I guess the food truck is the new hole in the wall), but there's something to be said for a restaurant that decorates the interior nicely, is sanitary, and keeps the quality consistent. So, whereas other taco/burrito vendors may make, on a good day, the more exciting Mexican food, Pancho's is the sort of place you'd actually want to hang out in. It's a neighborhood restaurant, friendly staff you get to know, and cheap beer specials. 

Hats off to you Pancho's.
author: Adam M.

description:
Solid burritos with meh-to-decent chips. Their veggie burrito has a legitimate array of vegetables in it, as opposed to the standard/boring bean-and-rice variety vegetarians usually get saddled with.

You're in the area and want a burrito? This is the spot for you.
author: Greg P.

description:
This place is a total hole in the wall, but it's delicious and affordable which is hard to find in the sea of "upscale" Mexican joints around here.

Unlimited salsas too.
author: Sean F.

description:
I went to Pancho's this afternoon with an eye on trying a new taco/burrito place near my house. It goes without saying that Nick's Crispy Taco's was presented to me within weeks of moving to SF, and I love it, but I wanted to try something else and see what else I could find.

The ambience is much preferable to Nick's or many other taquerias; it has nice designs on the wall, many tables, and a helpful and cheery staff. The food came out relatively quickly, and was served with some chips, but only like 8 literal chips - king of annoying. The salsa bar is nice and high quality (I really liked the green salsa quite a bit), but you have buy an extra thing of chips to really take advantage, unlike some other places that give you enough side chips for free to enjoy the salsa.

I ordered a Borracho Burrito after reading some other Yelp reviews. I found the sauce to be interesting if nothing else, but a little too re-inventing the wheel for me. I couldn't really taste the cheese or guacamole, although the tortilla and meat were spot on. In general, I thought it was pretty good and different than a normal SF burrito, but nothing earth-shattering, if you ask me. Disappointing too because it is more expensive than El Super Burrito on Sutter and Polk, which offers unlimited chips/salsa with your burrito, and is more expensive than two Nick's crispy tacos. Again, I liked the salsa alot, though. I might come back next time and go to town on the salsa, order something more traditional, and enjoy the nice vibe of this place. 

In general, I'd say Pancho's is definitely worth a swing-by quick lunch, and a good business to support helpful and cheery staff, although don't expect a life-changing meal in any context.
author: Andrew M.

description: Mmmm Burrito! ...honestly I've had better and I've had worse, these were not too shabby and successfully filled my burrito craving.
author: Maria E.

description:
Nearest burrito place near my house.. not bad
Their basic no frills rice+beans burrito is pretty good..
salsa bar is not bad.. i like the ones at tropisueno and little chihuahua a lot more though
good after-work takeout place for me!
author: Aditya M.

description:
I have to say, this place has some darn good fish tacos. Big pieces of fish is what really makes them really awesome. I don't get all the hype of Nick's Cripsy tacos. Is that place supposed to be a bar, a douchebag club or a taco joint? Something just doesn't connect. 

However, if you walk down Polk, you will find Bob's doughnuts and Pancho's. It's a win, win. 

Another thing that is really awesome about this place is the fresh tortilla chips and the salsa bar with all the right fixins. Trust me, all of the salsas are good, which is a rarity. It's also pretty cheap compared to Nick's. (Once again I really just don't get the yelp hype on that place). 

The only reason why I give this place 4 and not 5 is due to the fact the rice is more boring than my social life as of recently.
author: Krista N.

description:
Hmm, how to rate this place. I have been here several times before Yelp and always enjoyed this place. However this time was my most disapointing visit. If this was my first time here I would only give 2 stars, but I averaged the 4 star visits from before to come up with the 3 stars. 
On this visit I was greated and had my order taken quickly, but it went down hill from there. I ordered a 2 taco combo meal and sat down. Then another customer came in and ordered to go. They cooked my food, put it in the window. Then the other guy's food came up, they then got the to go order ready and sent him on his way, while my food sat in the window. When they brought me food, I then had to ask for chips.
The food might have been very good if served quickly, but when I got it, it was not very hot, had water on the plate, so the tacos were a little soggy. The flavor was good, and I do love the salsa bar.
author: Steve A.

description: I like the place. The decor is fun, with some old movie posters and ads from Mexico. The food was good -- I had a burrito with their BBQ sauce, which is sweet and spicy and quite large.  The man at the counter was friendly and bought the plate to my table.  There's a list of daily specials on the board to the right of the cash register.
author: Dan C.

description: I've been going here for about ten years.. it's a neighborhood staple, basically! The food is fresh and the service is good, attentive, and polite. I'm not a huge fan of their burritos or nachos, but in a rush, they'll definitely do!
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Matt was hungry and had a craving for a Burrito, but not willing to drive out to the Mission and waste gas, valuable time looking for parking and smelling like poo afterwards.

Pancho's is closer and walking distance from the Fantastic-4's crib. Matt bought a Carnitas Super-Burrito with all the fixing inside the Deluxe Silver-Bullet. The $7.00 SB was a hefty size and very yummy for a Taqueria in this mid-section of Polk St., though this place might not win in a battle between the best taquerias in the city, like Matt aforementioned on a prior review. This place might surprise some judges and critics on their surprisingly tasty food

The taqueria was quiet and the staff was very stern and composed themselves very well, as Matt devoured his SB like a wild carnivorous animal from National Geographics. Some of you Yelpers, who have seen Matt eaten like a Human garbage-disposal, his monsterous appetite is back!!
author: Matt G.

description:
This place presents one of the many Yelp dilemmas: how to rate a place where you REALLLLLLY LOVE only one particular item on the menu?

Until recently, Pancho's was often subjected to my general distaste for all things Polk. I found their burritos mediocre, giving them at least two or three tries with each one faring no better than the previous. In the end, I was more than prepared to consider Pancho's another wart on the anus-flesh that is Polk St. 

And then I tried their tacos... which have only just become my FAVORITE thing about my neighborhood. 

I don't know for sure, but on the subject of their taco tortillas, I'm willing to bet some little Mexican grandma is out there rolling and pounding these little bits of bliss into fruition. I can practically taste that smothering, latino-mother love in each bite.

And where else can things go but up once you drop a small pile of deliciously seasoned carnitas on top? Hand me a Mexican coke and call it a day motherf***er I'm SOLD!

So back to my quandary... I very much adore their tacos, and indeed they are now a regular part of my increasingly shameful diet, but I must concede it's just plain wrong when people hand out a five star rating because a restaurant happens to do one thing very well... but perhaps my aversion to a five-star rating in this situation runs deeper... 

Perhaps I can't give it five stars because I often say rude, judgmental, borderline ignorant things about people who freely dole out a lot of five-star ratings. Indeed, I am just that type of person.
author: Brian K.

description:
I got a steak Borracho Burrito and it was disgusting. I should've known better than to think that barbecue sauce would be alright on a burrito. The steak was dry and lacked just about every quality to think that what you were eating might be a burrito.

I actually really liked the salsa bar because there wasn't a lot of salt in them.
author: Russ R.

description:
Was in San Francisco for the weekend and craving some good authentic mexican food. We heard about this place just around the corner from our hotel. 

Boy, were we disapointed!  This place was not the real taste of Mexico we antcipated!  The carnitas and grilled steak burrito were bland to the core and needed a lot of "on the table" spicing up.  The taste of the tamales and rice were the same - no latin flare. 

One positive, the beer was nice and cold. Overall, would not recommend !
author: Mike P.

description:
I went here because it totally slipped my mind on Tuesday that Nick's has their taco tuesday night... and I didn't feel like waiting in line. I begrudgingly followed the better half to Panchos, and was pleasantly surprised.

Really decent ambiance with a bunch of fun crap on the walls. Nice people behind the counter, and it wasn't too busy at all. Both my fiance and I have selective eating habits, so we made a bunch of changes to our food, with no issues whatsoever. Ten minutes later, our hot fresh delicious food was brought to the table. Ample portions, tasty, fresh ingredients. 

It wasn't quite as good as Nick's Crispy Taco's... but it most certainly sufficed in a pinch. I'd come back.
author: Nick B.

description: I love this place. Amazing corn tortillas and really nice staff.
author: Amy S.

description: Hit or miss - passable Mexican food; not very notable. Good, fast service.
author: Nipul C.

description:
I like stopping by Pancho's on my walks home from work. I always order a burrito and it's always tasty. 

Free chips in the bag, a well stocked salsa bar, and a nice environment to wait in. Thank you, Pancho's, for being there for me when I'm hungry.
author: Madeline N.

description:
I know a good burrito when I taste one and unfortunately, Panchos fell abundantly short for me. After a long night of happy hour'dom, I was ready ready ready for a delicious, piping hot, flavorful, gargantuous burrito. With Pancho's I didn't even get one out of the four desires. It was bland, cold and definitely not as gargantuous as most of the gargantuous burritos I get in the Loin. 

They use "fresh" ingredients and I've considered that in my rating. The guacamole they used definitely tasted like it had been made just minutes before they served it. The chips were actually pretty damn amazing. Typically the tortilla chips that places serve don't taste good by themselves; you HAVE to have salsa with them. But not with Pancho's chips. I was poppin' those puppies naked and loved every ounce of them. 

Bottom line: If their burritos were as good as their chips it'd be a 5 star rating for sure.
author: Julia N.

description: The burritos here are great! I also have had a quesadilla and it was good too. The staff is friendly  the 3 star rating is because I ended up with a small rock in my burrito that apparently had slipped into the beans? I called them and let them know what happened and to give the chefs a heads up. They were nice about it, but said it happens sometimes... so watch out!
author: Kristina B.

description: One of my favorite casual Mexican restaurants.  Have to say that they do seem to have "off" days when things seem rushed though.
author: John C.

description: Eh.  Ok for an edible burrito.  I usually only end up here because I am with a bunch of friends who are in a hurry to eat and can't agree on anything else.  Nothing special.
author: M S.

description: Rating based only on Chips & Salsa and 2 Dos XX at 4pm on a Sunday.
author: Andy T.

description:
A little expensive, not the best location, but the salsa and burritos are top-notch. And it's next door to Bob's for desert. (And Lafayette, if you're going to or from it on a Saturday.)

Get a chicken fajita burrito on a chile wrap -- my favorite burrito in the city (and I am extremely picky about my Mexican food).
author: Jono S.

description:
i need to come back and try the potato, eggs, rice, cheese burrito for $4.99.  

$7.01 for a carne asada. ($1.04 to add guacamole) it's decent for the area. the salsa bar is not bad either.
author: Ameer N.

description:
On a late night hunt for food, we came here and were completely impressed.

Baha Fish tacos (deep fried) and Carnitas tacos were just outstanding.  Plenty of meat and super tasty.
author: Raider J.

description: I agree with other reviewers, the food is a bit blunt. I had the veggie burrito and guacamole on the side. The burrito was good, the guac was lacking flavour. Pancho's definitely a good place if you need a quick cheap burrito fix, and there aren't many Mexican places in the area (as far as I know).
author: Lisa O.

description: 3.5 stars seem more accurate. It seemed popular, lots of people coming in and out, mostly for takeouts. It's in Polk Gulch and most seemed like they were nursing a hangover from the night before haha. I'm from San Antonio so I consider myself an expert on Mexican food. This one is good enough. Everything tasted pretty good. We ordered nachos, and the steak fajita burritos. I liked their salsa bar.. just took everything to our table. Service was fast, you order at the counter and they bring food to you. Decent prices. No restroom though! I'd eat here again.
author: Vol T.

description:
300th review and i'm writing about Panchos...maybe because it's 3 in the morning and i have cravings...uh oh!

5 stars for their chips and salsa!! soooooo warm and fresh..i can eat bags! 

4 stars for their chicken tacos! Comes w/ 2 per order and loads of chicken.

5 stars for opening late...i felt so guilty for eating at 10:30pm on a weekday, but just couldnt resist...why cant they be open at 3am though??? darn!
author: M W.

description: I stopped by Pancho's for the first time yesterday after living in the area for five years. Super hungry and in need of a quick snack, Pancho's totally delivered. The staff was super nice and friendly. Their menu explains that tacos are sold in pairs, but I asked for a single taco as a snack and the cashier gave me a mega-watt smile and sold me a single taco. The taco was good, but not like a good old Filibertos of Tucson. I'll go back for a quick snack anytime.
author: Alice S.

description:
I still love this place after so many years of coming here. The food is always great. I went to the first Pancho's back when I lived in Berkeley. They have a huge location there. 

Once I moved to San Francisco I was happy they had one here. The food is always fresh and it is priced well. The salsa bar is great and always restocked often. Nice people and the place is always clean.

I try to hit this place at least once every 7 to 10 days.
author: don h.

description: SPOILER ALERT! They use canned beans. Don't be fooled like I was by their "we're-a-real-mexican-restaurant-I-promise!" decor.
author: Gretchen V.

description: this place is soooooooooo goooooooooooooooood. i loooooooooooooove their burritooooooooooooooooooooos. steaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaak. sooooo goooood. yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
author: Andrew G.

description: Panchos is a three star burrito shop.  Some things come out right, but others don't.  For example, the corn tortillas themselves are fantastic -- we sometimes just buy the tortillas and take them home to make our own food since they are better than store bought.  The salsas, in contrast, are a pale, sloppy mess.  If you get a burrito, you'll be pleasantly satisfied, but you won't mistake it for anything you'd get in the Mission.  All in all, Panchos works because it's the only game in the hood.  I wish they had some competition...
author: Laurence W.

description: 20 minutes for two tacos??  Tacos??  Seriously?  These people don't seem to believe in capitalism.  The tacos were plain with an ok taste, but again, 20 minutes?  Don't come here.  Worst spent $15 of all time...
author: Jaime C.

description: The chicken mole is the best around. Fantastic little take-out place with homemade corn tortillas to order. One chicken mole with extra tortillas = food for 2 people! Their chips and salsa bar are second to none.
author: Kristen K.

description: Pancho's is great if you're in a hurry or just want something cheap without a line. Honestly though, the food isn't that great. I've tried both the carne asada burrito and cheese quesadilla and neither were even close to spectacular. Additionally, the guacamole was terrible!! I would only recommend this if you live in the neighborhood & don't have much time.
author: Sarah L.

description: We got shrimp fajitas and a shrimp salad. Both pretty good and loved the salsa bar, especially the spicy marinated veggies. The corn tortillas were really fresh and yummy. But the 2 entrees could have been bigger, and this is from 2 of us that are not big eaters, not that much grilled veggies/shrimp with the fajitas. I always get shrimp salads at mexican places and still prefer the one at the little chihuahua to this one. What was there was good though, will have to try something else next time.
author: Faina G.

description: Hand made tortillas were really good everything else not so much. Customer service was good but food was horrible I can make better Mexican food. Still trying to find a good Mexican place on this side of town
author: Evelyn D.

description: Finally stopped in after walking by many times. Clean venue with friendly staff. Large and smaller burrito options. Diverse menu which can accomodate for various diets. They take credit cards which is awesome and they make recycling and composting your rubbish easy. Will definitely return.
author: Heather L.

description: It must be difficult to be down the street from Nick's Crispy Tacos but Pancho's stands in there and gives as good as it gets.  I occasionally stop in for a burrito and I give the carnitas a thumbs up.  You could do a lot worse.
author: Jay D.

description:
Pancho's VS Nick's

GO TO PANCHO's and TASTE THE LOVE

Pancho's is the best Mexican food on Polk hands down.  Considering that their only competition is Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Nick's is a great place only if you are too drunk to walk down a couple blocks to Pancho's.  First of all-Nick's does look like a brothel and is dark and dingy, as soon as you walk in.  It always has sticky floors, and what 's that fermented, damp-rag smell?  I'm always afraid to touch any surface in that place. The food at Nick's taste old, and you can tell there's no love in it's preparation adn it's always always slopped together.

Pancho's on the other hand has great food.  I have gone and ordered down the menu and have never been disappointed.  All their dishes are lovingly prepared, my favorite would have to be the taquitos dorados: three rolled corn tortillas filled with chicken, fried (but never greasy), served with lettuce cheese and rice and beans.  

The tacos are also very delicious, made to order, again with love.  You can taste the LOVE in those hand made corn tortillas...very authentic and have only tasted better in Mexico.  
The selection  of Salsas is great, the salsas themselves are made several times aday so you know it's always fresh.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED...
author: Jon B.

description: Cool layed back resteaurent!  Really good food and relatively cheap for the huge food portions.  I highly recommend this Mexican place!
author: Thomas B.

description:
It's just ok. The prices are a little bit lower than better Mexican places but that is also reflective of the quality of the food. Service is just ok too - a little slow but fine.

Stick with the burritos - I made a mistake ordering one of the combo meals and depsite being hungry could only finish about half the plate.
author: Pan P.

description: They have an actual salsa bar!  Everything was delicious. Fast friendly service. Not a single complaint. Good stuff.
author: douglas B.

description:
I love Pancho's because everything is fresh. Even at 10pm right before closing, they give you the warmest paper thin tortilla chips. Their veggie burrito is the perfect indulgent midnight snack. Not too big but enough to fill your stomach with fresh steamed veggies, rice, and the perfect (small) amount of cheese. Their all you can eat fresh salsa variety is just excellent. I also love their chicken soup and their tortilla soup, plus their Fish Tacos (the fried and non-fried fish are both great). You really don't need to walk all the way down to Nick's for a great fish taco :-). 

Pancho's is a unique taqueria which has maintained their standard of freshness and quality for many years now. I'm happy to see it's a loved institution. What's also fun is going to Panchos and buying a load of their cheese-stuffed jalapeno poppers and heading to the Big Foot for beers. Ai Carumba.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
Personally i really enjoy this place for a burrito. 
its very close to my house, the salsa bar is plentiful and fresh and has a delicious variety. the tortillas are super good, chili tortilla?!?! Z0mg!
i enjoy the fajita burrito with carne asada, as well as their breakfast burritos! 

the service is super good as well! id for sure suggest it.
author: Elliott G.

description: As others have mentioned, the Borracho Burrito is truly special and tasty.  But I also love their veggie burrito.  Their chips and salsa are both also exceptional.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Very tasty food. Nice selection and GREAT service. Very quick and very clean place. Wish more places along Polk Street kept up their space inside and out. 
Everyone here seems to take pride and ownership in their work and the food there.
author: John G.

description:
Ick... Just ate dinner here tonight because we were too lazy to drive out to the Mission. Lesson Learned: travel for quality.

We both got "grilled steak" burritos, mine w/ guacamole. I failed to notice that the burrito comes with lettuce, which is my pet peeve in burritos- I think it's hideous. But it was my fault that I didn't request the burrito without lettuce, so I won't hold it against them. 

What I will hold against them is the fact that the "grilled steak" tasted like dog food. It had this distinctive, very unappealing scent that immediately turned me off. I ate 1/3 of the burrito because it actually took me awhile to reach the steak, but I gave up soon after. I'm still shuddering thinking about how gross it was.

The one thing that doesn't seem like a total Yelp-lie is the yummy fresh tortillas. I ordered one on the side and it saved me from my butt-rito. I can't understand how a place with such quality tortillas can serve such shameful burritos. Both me and my boyfriend were bummed.

Salsa bar was okay, although only two were actually tasty. 3 of the 4 were very watery. Chips were fine, but Nick's (down the street) serves stuff that's WAYYY better.

Yeah... I'd never come back here. I guess this is one of those times when I just have to shake my head in disbelief at the people who rate this place 5 stars. Do we even live in the same universe?
author: Amanda C.

description: I'm new to the city, but I can't believe it gets much better than this. The steak and shrimp burrito kicks ass and so do the fish tacos. The salsa bar rocks too.
author: Poogie P.

description: very mediocre experience. i ordered the steak fajitas and the meat had no flavor and everything else was bland. good value as just about everything on the menu is less than $10, but there is definitely better mexican to be had in the city.
author: Chris M.

description:
I really want to love Pacho's I mean really do but I always end up in the "just friends" zone. 

The food is always perfectly adequate but it never really surprises me. Extra points for having a well balanced veggie menu and for giving out free chips with every meal. 

If you want awesome Mexican stick to the mission but if you are on the Polk and are craving a burrito Pancho's will make you one that hits the spot...okay well hits a little to the left of the spot.
author: Nerd A.

description: Great price, yummy burrito, yummy green salsa and fresh thin crispy chips = lunch perfection.
author: arlene r.

description:
A solid Mexican option when Nick's Crispy Tacos is too crowded. 

Pancho's has a kooky but relaxed sensibility.

It's just an easy option for Mexican when on Polk St.
author: Sophie D.

description:
Chicken Borracho Burrito, por favor!

Gracias, Burrito de polla, por su ayuda cuando estoy cruda y tengo mucho hambre. Me gusta beber cervezas, y a veces estoy borracho. Entonces, en la manana proxima cuando estoy cruda el burrito borracho es perfecto para mi! !Gracias Pancho!

For those of you no hablan espanol, I love Panchos for hangover food. I zip over here on a nice little 2 block long, soothing stroll, getting some air  and sunshine into my system and get mi burrito to help my hungover ass not die of starvation/ lack of nutrients and/ or electrolytes/ vitamins. Then, the nice people at Panchos give me a delicious burrito, full of chicken, beans, rice, a generous helping of guacamole, and some special borracho sauce, for $7 and some change.

I think borracho sauce helps people who were borrachos the night before, yes? Add some hot salsa, and I am a new woman!

I mean it's a little gringo- y, but I'm just a guerra cruda. Who am I to complain?
author: Katie H.

description:
Tasty steak burritos here - one my favorite takeout spots back when it was on my way home from work.  Good salsa bar, constantly restocked by the attentive staff.  

Would have given them the full 5 stars but the cute cashier girl seems immune to my mental suggestions.  Yes, no matter how much I smile and twinkle my eyes, she doesn't seem to understand that I would like her to toss in a few extra chips...
author: Steve H.

description: This place is great. Their service is so fast. I don't know how they do it, and their prices are totally reasonable. As well, their staff is very friendly and. I eat here at least once a week.
author: dAvid s.

description:
This review is long overdue.  I was reminded of how long overdue this review of "Pancho's" truly is, when I (tried) to eat at the veritable sh**hole, "Crema" in the Chelsea district of New York - a restaurant so horrifying that it actually inspired me to write my very first "Yelp" review.

As a former resident of Pac Heights  in San Francisco, I am ashamed to say that I took this little gem, "Pancho's", for granted; ordering often and without a single regret.

As I now reside in New York, I have but one thing to say:

I MISS YOU PANCHO'S!  
YOU COMPLETE ME!

Thank you for years of perfectly spiced fish tacos, and the only chicken tacos so amazingly good that I was forced to turn my back on my vegetarian diet from time to time (be sure to order the "higher end" chicken tacos as they are served as part of the "#2 Combo", if memory serves).

Also, be sure to order extra chips (made fresh and served warm) and don't mess around with the self-serve salsa bar - just bite the bullet and get a half pint of ANY one of their freshly prepared salsas AND do the same with their guacamole.  Seriously, the best in this solar system.

And for those of you who have complained about slow service...? Try throwing a few bucks in the tip jar when you order.  I've always tipped and have always received fast, courteous service.

And in case you're wondering, NOT tipping at a little joint like this DOES absolutely earn you at least one, full month of bad karma.
author: Jim W.

description:
Oh Pancho's, you're like the girl next door but not the really cute girl-next-door type but rather just the actual girl who happens to live next door. 

You're so, so close. And it's just so, so easy. But c'mon, let's not pretend. We both know I've had better. I mean, it's not like I've never caught a glimpse of that Latin girl a few neighborhoods south.

But let's look on bright side Pancho - Monday nights still come 4 times month.
author: Tom C.

description:
I was pretty underwhelmed with my chicken fajita burrito, which was very dry and seemed to not have any of the things the menu listed it would.

But their chicken soup was a welcomed shot of healing into a household that's under the weather.

Prices are high, but what did I expect for this part of town?
author: Jason R.

description:
Great Taqueria, especially since there aren't many choices in the Nob Hill/Russian Hill/Pac Heights zone.  They have fresh ingredients and  I've been happy with almost everything I've ordered.  Better yet, they are fast and inexpensive.  They also have a cute small Taqueria atmosphere if you're walking down Polk and looking for a place to drop in.  OH and a great selection of Salsa's .  No beer on tap unfortunately, but they have bottled beer.  

I still long for the Mexican and Latin food in the Mission, but Pancho's will do for now.  They also have some good options for the Nob Hill/Pac Heights crowd - like lots of veggie selections and whole wheat tortillas for the health conscious.
author: Peter S.

description:
Pancho's answered a long standing question: Is squash appropriate in a veggie burrito? The answer is a resounding yes.

Slightly high prices, but the massive steamed veggie goodness wrapped in a wheat tortilla was worth every peso, er, penny.
author: Jason B.

description:
There definitely not too many places to grab something Mexican eats in Russian Hill, so between this place and Nick's Crispy Tacos on the other end of Polk St., you've pretty much reached your options limit.

I do enjoy their nachos, and their crispy taquitos though.  Try the chicken though, their steak/asada has a tendency to be a little chewy and dry.

P.S.  They have great aguas frescas too!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
We ended up here because Sliders is cash only and we left our house without the ATM card. No worries, we ended up having a fish burrito that was really tasty. The service was what you'd anticipate. You stand in line. Then you pay. You sit and someone brings you your burrito. Plain and simple. 

Not so simple? The ambiance at this chain-is cheesier than the food. Every surface slathered with Corona promotional materials including depictions of girls in bikinis and parrots cozily cuddling their cool long-neck bottles. We sat at the bar style seats along the side wall and avoided the spectacle of watching the parade of "residentially challenged" down Polk Street while Ranchero songs belted out of the sound system muffling the crunch of chips at each table.  

I know a good taqueria when I walk into one and Pancho's is Mex-American blah. Burrito snobbery aside, the Mahi Mahi burrito was a nice surprise.
author: Jessica D.

description:
Good but not great.  I had a burrito--not much to rave about.  Fairly cheap.  Service was great.  Personable and quick.  

Fairly quiet on Saturday night.  Our group sat undisturbed for quite a while.  

Burritos were just so-so.  The salsa was pretty good though!  If I'm in the neighborhood, I might try again.  Otherwise, I'm happy with Gordo's around the corner from me.
author: Melissa Q.

description:
This place hates giving out their meat. I've given them plenty of chances, and always...no meat.

"Too much!" the manager screams at the chef as he slaps his hand. "What if the earthquake happens tomorrow?" he continues. "Then what would we do, what would WE eat?"

This place gets one star for having Dos Exious(sp?) on draft. Asides from that, goddamn. The final straw on reviewing this place was when I went there for lunch today. I had just got done working out and was in need of some serious protein. When I work out, I don't fuck around, people get killed. So I went there and got the fish tacos. When they brought them out I laughed. "Seven grams of protein?" I asked them. "This is a joke, right?"
author: Dave G.

description:
Don't act like you can't get a legitimate burrito on Polk Street. You go here, or you go to La Parilla and you have a perfectly lovely time. Oh you like only crud in the Mission? It has to be cooked dirtball to be good? You are just like those girls who would rather date the STD-infested rockstars than your nice neighbor who will never cheat on you!

I'm sorry. You're not like that. You don't like Nick's Crispy Tacos either?! Let's hold hands and skip.
author: Shannon V.

description: Dissapointed. I've been a few times, and it continuously is below my expecations. I will realistically continue to go, it is the closest place to get a burrito to my house.
author: osmahn k.

description:
NEVER had bad guacamole here
chips are always freshhhhhhhhhh
carnitas-absolutely delicious
friendly accommodating staff
great flour tortillas
quesadillas are excellent
refired beans-delicious
a real find!
author: Chris D.

description: decent food and salsa bar, didnt knock my socks off for price or quality.  next time I'll try a burrito.  my last visit I had vegetarian soft tacos.
author: Beth W.

description:
EDIT 3/24/07:  Practices poor customer service.  Sorry, but it's bad enough that you fuck up my burrito, not once, but twice, AND not even apologize for it.  It's too bad, too, because I really liked their breakfast burrito.  

------------------------

The burrito tasted flavorful.  And the chips were crispy, far from the stale chips I've tasted at other taquerias.  Service was quick and friendly, and there's also a dining area, which makes it nice if you want to scarf down your meal on the spot (like I did).  There aren't many options when scouting for mexican food in this area, but Pancho's surely satisfies.
author: Marsha Z.

description: For those of you commenting that it's not "authentic", what do you know of authentic? If you want authentic, go to Mexico and order a plate of food at various restaurants. Watch "Mexico One Plate at a Time" on PBS. Otherwise, the decor is pretty darn authentic as well as the music. So is the soup and home made corn tortillas. The Boracho burrito with sour cream is very tasty. Pancho's is not perfect, but what place is?
author: Michelle V.

description:
Great Happy Hour!  

How can you go wrong with cheap drinks and great food!?  
Wanna' share a can of Tecate?!
author: Lauren C.

description:
After a long hike up and down the streets of Nob Hill and Russian Hill, I was ready for a hearty lunch. I'd been talking with my friend about good places to get Mexican food for the last 30 minutes, so, of course, that's all we could think about. We decided to give Pancho's a try

I'd been hoping they'd have some sort of vegetable nachos, but sadly they only have vegetarian nachos. In other words, no yummy veggies on top, just the typical non-meat nachos ingredients. However, they did have a perfectly good-sounding veggie burrito, so that's what we both ordered. We both agreed that they were delicious. I was disappointed by the fact that there were green bell peppers in mine, but she was happy there were no carrots; we did enjoy the onions, broccoli, red bell peppers (and more). 

I can't stop writing without mentioning the decor in this place. There is a tropical beach-front feel to the restaurant, with all sorts of things (sombreros, surf boards, octopi, etc.) actually sticking out of the walls and mounted on the ceiling.
author: Katie I.

description:
Wow, after reading all of the horror stories I feel bad about giving this place 3 stars, but I like their fajita burrito and chicken tacos., so its gets 3 stars by me.

The decor is kind of cheesy, but I never eat there I take it to go. It is one of the only Mexican food places near my place so I am a regular. I have had much better in the mission and even in the FiDI, but this place inst SO bad, but I definitely don't crave it.
author: Jessica R.

description: Legit happy hour, friendly staff, works when I'm craving a little latin flavor!
author: Jodie B.

description:
Admittedly, many of these types of restaurants use rice as a filler for their burritos. The easiest way to take care of this situation? Ask for no rice. 

Their chicken fajita burritos are my absolute favorite, the chicken is tender and the grilled peppers and onions are delicious. Even with the rice omitted I can't finish one myself. As others have said, their chips are hot and crispy. If you're feeling adventurous, add in a Mexican Coca-Cola and you've got yourself an awesome meal and a full tummy.
author: Lori M.

description:
I'm a neighborhood regular at Panchos. It is right around the corner and is my quick fix. It is not the best mexican I've ever had, nor is it the worst. The prices may be a little high for a basic taqueria, but consider the rent on Polk Street as the explanation for that. This is not the Mission. 

To address some of the other complaints seen here: 1) I'm not a fan of the meat served in ANY taqueria or ethnic place, so I just never order meat; 2) staff is not dumb; they are good, earnest folks just making a living and mistakes happen; 3) I can't speak to the supposedly bland burritos b/c I don't order them. My favorite dishes are the enchiladas and the tostada salad. Quesadillas are small and simple, good for kids. 

WHAT'S GOOD:
- abundant warm, fresh, salty chips!
- guacamole
- salsa bar
- consistency of product; my favorites are always just as I expect
- i get a kick out of the goofy decor
- easy, casual neighborhood place

NOT SO GREAT:
- bathrooms at places like this are always dicey
- gets cold in there, they like to leave the window above the door open, so i always try to sit towards the back
- sometimes my "to go" orders get mixed up, since I always ask for "no this" and "extra that". I always end up with chicken when i don't want it, so now i check before i take it away and try to not be too complicated when calling in an order.

Overall, I am a fan and think it is a great addition to the neighborhood. Definitely check it out for yourself.
author: Ponytail W.

description:
The homemade tortillas are plainly delicious and they gave me a small side salad and lots of chips with my order of tacos to go (didn't expect it, so it was a pleasant surprise). 
Observing carefully the decor, the place could easily be the setting for a Bunuel film ;-)
Dinner was good; the price was reasonable. I'll definitely come back.
author: Rosa L.

description:
Yelp you never steer me wrong....

I had a hankering for some cuisine de Mexique, but I didn't want to venture all the way to the Mission for some good eats, nor did I feel like paying $10 for a burrito. 

So Yelp led me here....literally 2 blocks from my place, it's exactly what I wanted.

Super fresh Mexican food with a great salsa bar!! You can tell there are plenty of gringo/as in the area since the jalapenos/carrot salsa was picked over and was just jalapeno salsa =0)

The #3 combo is super fulfilling (cheese quesadilla, small chicken/steak burrito, chips & quac). I ate as much as i could and ate only half of it. Which was great cus it made a really yummy lunch the next day.

The staff is friendly and hospitable. I plan on making numerous stops here in the future!!
author: Rana A.

description:
Great grilled chicken quesadillas made on FRESH tortillas.

Quick, fresh, cheap, friendly and clean - all good things.
author: Adam B.

description:
I first tried Pancho's a week ago and have already been back twice since then.  On my first visit I ordered a Borracho Burrito with steak and without the salsa. (Grilled chicken or steak in a homemade Mexican BBQ sauce with black beans, rice, salsa, cheese, and guacamole in a chile tortilla.)  I liked it so much that I went back the next day and had another one, this time with a side of sour cream which nicely cut the spice of the BBQ sauce just a bit without making it completely bland. (I'm a real lightweight when it comes to spicy foods.)

Today, I took my boyfriend who had a steak Borracho Burrito (with salsa) at my suggestion and absolutely loved it.  I decided to try something different and got a grilled chicken Quesadilla on corn tortillas.  Oh my god.  Their homemade corn tortillas are so delicious!  Now, this quesadilla might have disappointed some people, since it contained only grilled chicken, cheddar cheese, and jack cheese, but, given my aforementioned lightweight status, I was very happy with it.  (For those of you who can handle more heat, there's always the option of dipping it in one of the salsas from their salsa bar.)

The place is small, so it can be a bit difficult to get between the tables when it's really busy.  Also, getting to the bathroom requires one to go through the kitchen, which I always hate doing because I feel like I'm in the way of the kitchen staff.  I'm not factoring those things into my rating, just noting them here for the benefit of others.

I wouldn't compare the food here to that of a taqueria in the Mission; I think they're somewhat different beasts.  I'll keep visiting my favorite place in the Mission, but I'll also be going back to Pancho's many more times. (And both Mission taquerias and Pancho's are better than Chili's.)
author: Katrina J.

description: One of the better mexican places on polk, the chicken soup is awesome as well as the steak and shrimp burrito. the salsa bar is also very good and they don't scrimp on those condiments or chips
author: N A.

description: The guac here is very good and the people are very friendly. Burritos are not their strength. Steak tacos are great.
author: Anthony B.

description:
I dunno what the hell Mike C. is talking about the burritos being two meals in one !!!   Definitely not for me!!, let's take multiplicative inverse of that relation: I usually get *two* burritos for one meal, but that's not because they're small, rather they're tasty and I have a super speedy metabolism and massive appetite!

That said Panchos makes good burritos, not quite The Best Burrito (tm), but they're just around the corner and they're willing to work with me on extras like avacodo, which doesn't come standard. 4 stars!!
author: I. O.

description:
I don't know why everyone is hating on Pancho's. This restaurant is GREAT! Exactly half way from my boyfriend's and my apartment, it's a great meeting spot for a Mexican dinner. When I say dinner, I mean shrimp tacos, a steak fajita burrito and two beers for under $20. Beers are $1.50 Monday-Thursday - I have not seen that anywhere in the city. Not to mention the fresh salsa bar. YUM. Perfect dinner for a entry-level PR chick and her law student boyfriend. Wave to Pancho cooking in the back!

Update: I've stopped by recently and the food is not as good as usual. Possiby under new management? Pancho, where are you?
author: Defne A.

description:
The tortillas are really good, as in...REALLY GOOD. Thick, yummy - definitely buy these, even if you do not get the tacos.

The veggie tacoss are good, filled with grilled veggies, topped with some cheese sauce squirted on (calling this cheese is really a stretch), but they need salsa...which brings us to the not so good: the salsas are bad. I took my tacos home and added Trader Joe's salsa (I know, wtf? But that's the sad reality.)

Either BYOS, take your food home for the TJ's special or pick up the tacos and walk down the block to Nick's to steal their salsa off the tables.  In fact, I suggest that Pancho's staff takes a field trip so that they can taste how good salsa can be.

The guacamole was like mashed avocado with nothing added. Why? 

I did get some free chips, though and service with a smile, so you gotta love that.
author: Melissa G.

description:
The following is a mostly true story.

Once upon a time, I had a cute coworker.  I would walk past her every day and smile, and she would smile back.  It was nice.  Then I found out that Pancho's was her favorite Mexican restaurant in the city, and I never spoke to her again.

Pancho's burritos are bland.  They contain some unsavory chicken, crusty beans, and--get ready--iceberg f***ing lettuce.  That's not right.  Plus, it'll cost you $2 more than it would at a Mission taqueria.  

2 stars for the nice salsa bar and really friendly service that ultimately won't be enough to win my patronage a second time.
author: Karin H.

description:
It is hard to believe that I have been going to this place for nearly 14 years! This place totally got me through college!

The best mexican on Nob hill. The food is always fresh, the salsa bar is the best in the area and the prices are really cheap. Beers are really affordable and the always have something on tap for super cheap.

Not quite as good as some of the places in the mission, but for Nob hill it gets the job done.

A must do for the citzens of the tendernob, Nob and Russian hill.
author: Brian M.

description:
I woke up crazy early and hungry on Polk St. Walked by here, peeped out the menu, but noticed they don't open till 10am. I walked around for a half hour searching for a spot to get a breakfast burrito. I saw a few restaurants that had the item on the menu, but I wanted a real Mexican joint type greasy ass chorizo potato deal. i stuck it out an extra hour and walked in at 10am. It was stellar. Each burrito comes with a nice size side of freshly fried tortilla chips and the salsa bar is well maintained and clean. 

Came back a few days later and asked the register gal what was the best burrito. She suggested the carnitas and it did not disappoint. Not the best one I've ever had, but very good. I always hold the rice with burritos, and even without that waste of a filler, it was huge. Stuffed with pork, beans, cheese, lettuce, tomato. Bomb. I really liked the salsa verde and medium red salsa too.
author: John L.

description: A lovely dinner any night of the week. Bean rice and cheese burrito with their amazing spicy chili. I am drooling. And nachos. I rarely ordered anything different and have never found chili like theirs. hop skip and a jump from the apt. did not hurt either. Other than the chili, it's not something spectacular, but if I was hungry I would definitely go in. The special chili (salsa) is hot unless you like spicy foods.
author: Lenore F.

description:
Meh....I've had better indeed.

I cannot tell you how ecstatic I was to bring my super chicken burrito home the other day after walking 5 miles home from the Sunset. The "chicken" burrito was half filled with steak which was way over cooked and extremely hard to chew. The thing was 60% black beans, 30% meat, 5% sour cream and 5% shredded cheese. Needless to say it left much to be desired and I don't foresee going back any time soon. Though one redeeming quality is their salsa bar. I love options....especially when it comes to hot, hotter and really F*ing hot salsa. 

Perhaps a good spot after late night drinking on Polk and Escape from NY Pizza is too far of a walk.
author: Kristy M.

description: Probably the best mexican food I've had in a long time. The corn salad was great. The tamales just like mom used to make. The beans and rice were awesome. Great service. Super friendly and attentive. The reason I didn't give it better marks was spotting a roach scurrying along the wall the last time I was here. I guess it is a restaurant but I'd hope mgmt would spray on occasion...
author: Timoteo K.

description:
You have to take Pancho's for what it is: a good place to get decent mexican on the cheap and quick. If you have a little more time and money, you should walk a few more blocks down Polk to Nick's Crispy Tacos. If not, Pancho's will do.

I recommend the carnitas tacos, the chicken enchilada (especially with green sauce), and the atomic burrito. All quite tasty.
You get a free bag of tortilla chips that are warm, tasty, and go well with the salsa bar.

Finally (and importantly), their beer is cheap.
author: Nick L.

description: I miss Pancho's.  Every time I'm back in the neighborhood I try to make it in for a burrito.  I love that they give you chips and don't charge for them like some other taco places that I will not mention.   I love how fresh the salsa bar is, that they'll let you customize your burrito a million different ways with a smile, and I love their completely random decorations.
author: Amanda B.

description:
NEVER AGAIN. 

I came in here at 1pm on a Sunday, hoping to find a new burrito place. What a huge mistake. 
First off, the line was very long and the restaurant understaffed, the cashier was also putting together orders and bussing tables. But that wasn't a huge deal to me, it gave me time to look at the menu, and I was very excited about going back to try lots of the items. 
I wasn't surprised by the long wait to get my to-go bean and rice burrito.. Until I realized that numbers ahead of mine were being called. And not only that, people that  had arrived after me were already finished EATING their meals. I went to the front to ask and they said that they had lost my ticket but would get right on it. Now, I work in customer service, I know, shit happens, whatever. By this time it was about 2pm and I was kind of annoyed that my super quick trip got so dragged out, but I just wanted to get home and eat. 
Unfortunately, when I got home I discovered that my order was messed up, and the burrito had NOTHING on it besides beans and rice, even though the menu clearly states lettuce, salsa, cheese, whatever.
So now I was pissed off. I walked back down to the restaurant and asked for a refund as calmly as I could, and they tell me that it's not possible. NOT POSSIBLE? If I don't eat your food, how is a refund not possible?? They offered me another burrito done right this time, and even though I was angry I decided to take it because I'm still fucking hungry. It is now 3pm and I'm finally sitting down to eat this damn burrito.

It is not delicious at all, even chipotle could do better, seriously.

The best advice that I can give after this painfully long, unsatisfying experience is for you to go to Nicks. It's right down the street if you're already in the area, and there's a much higher chance that you'll actually get what you order. And then enjoy eating it. This place is not worth your time whatsoever.
author: Elisabeth G.

description: Eh probably deducted a star because they forgot my family's order. The food was decent, but I definitely had better Mexican food (spoiled by San Jose/Mission).
author: Tif L.

description:
Four stars for a simple reason:  I think this is the only restaurant in SF that has received a public endorsement from Julio Iglesias!  

For those who don't know, there's a autographed headshot of Julio hanging on the wall (in between fake fish, lassos, and neon signs) which reads:  "Pancho - Amor los burritos"  /s/ Julio Iglesias.

That pic always makes me smile.  Oh, and the food's not that bad either.  Steak fajita burrito and the steak torta are classics.  Fish tacos are also solid.  I can't speak for the rest of the menu, as I am a man of routine...much like Julio Iglesias?
author: Robson S.

description:
Outside the Mission, 
Great Mexi is hard to find, 
Tamale Grande!
author: Brian J.

description:
Imagine a scene out of Goldilocks and the 3 bears...but maybe instead of taking place at a home in the woods, it's on some urban street in San Francisco. And maybe instead of the protagonist having long soft golden locks, let's just say she has dark uncontrolled curly hair. We'll call her Curlyfro. 

So it's 11 p.m. and Curlyfro's stomach is growling! On the long drawn-out quest to find food, her search leads her and her cohorts to Pancho's. Why, what could better suit the need for post happy-hour munchies than good old-fashioned (fine, just good Americanized) Mexican food. 

Looking at the menu, Curlyfro is recommended the chicken tacos. She thinks to herself, "Psh! Why those won't fill me up! That's not enough to satiate my appetite!" Dissatisfied with that option, her head turns to the section entitled "Burritos". But just the thought of a huge one-pound burrito begins to scare Curlyfro - her appetite has begun to wane from where it was an hour earlier when the search for nourishment began. Her stomach may not be able to handle something as powerful as a burrito.

But lo and behold, Pancho's does not disappoint Curlyfro. A look to the bottom of menu brought Curlyfro to tears. "What - a SMALL burrito??? Can this be for real??? Is my intoxicated state fooling me???" See, a small burrito is not quite as heavy and large as an actual burrito, but still resembles a burrito in every sense; meaning that Curlyfro could eat the entire thing without wasting any food (waste is bad kids), and yet wouldn't feel her stomach exploding and regret her decision later than evening. 

Curlyfro found the perfect balance. She was happy. It was a good night.
author: Dalia K.

description: Love this place! Their corn tortillas are homemade which is a huge plus!! We also got a couple burritos which were delicious. The resto was very clean too. Will be back!
author: Lindsay D.

description:
What am I doing in Nob Hill hunting for a good burrito joint? Very counter-intuative, no? There's a reason they're called Mission-style burritos. 

SF taqueria geography lessons aside, I had just picked up two very hungry out-of-town friends in Russian Hill, & Polk St just so happened to the the closest restaurant thoroughfare on the way to our destination. It was decided that Mexican food was the cuisine of choice, & Pancho's hit the spot well enough.

It was about 1pm, & my deal with them was that the place in question had to have a yummy-sounding breakfast burrito, which of course, Pancho's did. And it didn't blow my mind, but it also didn't disappoint.

I wouldn't make any kind of special effort to come back, but if you live in  or near Nob Hill & this is your local taqueria, you're not in bad shape.
author: Pete J.

description:
this place is close to my apartment, but it seems like whenever i come here, i leave regretting i did so.

The vegetarian burrito is too soft, not very flavorful, tortilla isn't crisp enough, overwhelmed by the beans, etc.

Often it takes a really long time to get my food.  

i guess my favorite part is that the salsa bar is pretty good.
author: Dustin E.

description:
Pancho's is good for one thing and one thing only:  the Borracho burrito.  I've tried their tostadas, quesadillas, tacos, even their torta (I'm usually a huge torta fan wherever I go) but none of them is that good.  They're not bad, but you can't call them good either.  They're just "eh."

The Borracho burrito though is awesome.  They put this so-called barbeque sauce in it, which mixes in perfectly with the black beans and rice to create a kind of gooey, oozy mound of deliciousness surrounded by the meat (I recommend carne asada over the chicken, but you can request carnitas too), cheese, and guacamole.  And the best part about it all is that they wrap it in a "Chile tortilla" which tastes incredible, and never comes unfolded, gets torn, or otherwise let you down and make a mess while you're eating.

As a testament to how good this burrito is, I went on a Pancho's binge a few months ago and ate at least 3 Borracho burritos a week for dinner for about a month.  I'm not joking, I would come home, sit on my couch, try to resist the craving, and end up going to Pancho's to get it.  I even tried eating terrible Trader Joe's frozen burritos for lunch to rid me of my burrito appetite for dinner, and that didn't work.  Finally it was the fact that I'd gained 5 pounds that made me think twice about basing a large part of my nutritional intake on the Borracho burrito.  If it weren't for my complex about a pre-mature coronary episode or my desire to attract the opposite sex, I'd still be on that binge.
author: David G.

description:
Solid Mexican joint on Polk street. Fajita burrito is pretty tasty, and their salsas are definitely good. Not as good as say, the little chihuahua, but it definitely holds its own. Also, given its proximity to me, it is a great option for a quick bite

based on the yelp reviews, I think i need to try the borracho burrito
author: VL K.

description:
We just happened into Pancho's while wandering around the Polk Street Blues Festival and were delighted to find yet ANOTHER great Mexican food joint! All I can say is neither my wife nor I had ever encountered a better homemade corn tortilla. They are sublime. You may think it odd to get so worked up over a tortilla but YOU JUST DON'T UNDERSTAND!!!! A good tortilla is worth its weight in cornmeal.
Honestly, though, the ingredients were garden fresh and everything is made by hand on the premises. The prices were very reasonable and the portions generous, what's to keep it from rating 5 stars? Nothin'! We enjoyed the place and bet you will too. Check it out!
(I had the steak tacos which were topped with fresh guacamole and wrapped with insanely frseh and tasty tortillas. Served with rice and beans (fresh, fresh, fresh). My wife had the grilled chicken quesadillas with a rice and bean burrito... she loved 'em but couldn't finish the burrito... fortunately, I was there to bail her out.)
author: Philip F.

description:
Their burritos are fresh and fantastic - the steak burrito is surprisingly light and balanced (for a burrito), and my cheese quesadilla was awesome.  The handmade tortilla totally rocked my little world.

The decor is very casual and fairly quirky.  It's a good place to go with friends for chillaxin'.
author: Cat W.

description:
This is my go-to place to satisfy my Mexican cravings, not because it's anything special, but it's the only decent Mexican joint in the neighborhood. The food is good but not outstanding, and the service is inconsistent, depending on who happens to be working. 

Ingredients are always fresh and the salsa bar is great, but I'm always a little disappointed by the under-salted and overly greasy chips. I usually order the veggie burrito which is pretty good and predictable, or the veggie tostada which is yummy, but they never put enough veggies in it. The staff are all very sweet, but they have a track record of messing up something in my order about 50% of the time.
author: Emilie R.

description: This is a really good Mexican place considering how cheap it is.  I have been coming here for a while and their al pastor is really delicious.   I have always had a good experience here except for tonight.  It was so bad that I must give it 3 stars.  There is a new lady that works at the register (the youngish white lady, I think she is new).  We asked for 2 tostadas (which include sour cream).  When they came out, only one had sour cream.  We asked her for sour cream for the one that was missing it.  She asked to see our receipt. When we showed her, she said she said that they had probably put the sour cream on the other tostada.  What?!?!  She said of we wanted extra sour cream, we had to pay $0.50.  We pointed to show that there was no sour cream that is included.  She kept on arguing that we needed to pay $0.50 extra.  A really nice woman that worked in the kitchen came out because she heard us arguing, heard the issue, apologized and brought out the sour cream.  Meanwhile, the cash register  lady kept on being extremely rude and arguing.
author: Dulce F.

description: SD style burritos are to have no more than (or less than) three ingredients: carne asada, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  Seems simple enough, right?  What's not one of the ingredients in an SD style burrito?  Curry.  The damned carne asada tasted like it should be wrapped in naan instead of a tortilla.  I have no idea if the guac or pico de gallo were any good.  t don't care if you make it with hormone free this, or organic that, it's an SD style burrito I'm looking for.  Not an SD style shwarma.
author: Paul M.

description:
I have been totally ripped off!!!!!!!!!!!!

The grilled steak burrito should been renamed the "vegetarian burrito". Burrito includes plenty of beans, rice, sour cream, tortilla  (everything cheap - filler) except the meat!

SAVE YOUR HARD EARNED $6.39 - GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.
author: Herman S.

description: I live right by this joint so I've eaten here plenty of times. It's not bad but nothing outstanding; it's very convenient. The servers are friendly the salsa bar is good so it gets 4 stars from me.
author: Anthony C.

description: I really like to salsa bar but the Borracho sauce was so good I drank it. I don't know if all Borracho sauces are this good.
author: Bebe L.

description:
Such a mixed review list already for poor Pancho's.

I enjoyed this place.  I usually got the same thing:  chicken tamales.

Never was disappointed but it is a bit pricey for what you get.

Really the only decent mexican joint in Polk area.
author: Diego S.

description:
Pancho's = Not a Mission taqueria, it isn't that great, but if you're in the mood for a burrito, quickly, and you're in the Marina or Nob Hill, this isn't a bad alternative.  The burritos are alright, try the atomic burrito, it's smothered and is actually pretty good with the red sauce.

I think the problem with Pancho's is that they don't put much flavor in their meat, so everything you get doesn't have much flavor.  The salsas are generally tasty but aren't quite up to par with some of the better taquerias in the Mission.

I guess not every place can be Farolito or Cancun in my book, so maybe I'm just spoiled...
author: Craig E.

description:
I get that when ordering grub at an "ethnic" restaurant, there is a high chance of your order getting screwed up because something was lost in translation. But when the waiter brings our plates (we both had grilled mahi mahi tacos) and asks who had the one with no cheese, and places 2 identical dishes in front of us (both WITH cheese), there was no miscommunication - just a dumbass waiter. He realized his mistake, left the food on the table, and went back to his other orders, completely disregarding the cheesy mishap. Ummm... my friend is lactose intolerant! It took so long to get the tacos in the first place, she just ate them (con queso) and got a stomach ache (which, I suppose is her fault, but I still hold dumbass waiter responsible).

The tacos really weren't that impressive anyway. 1 star for the tub of guac.
author: Valerie N.

description:
Man, was just about to pop on here and give Pancho's a happy 5 stars, but the last time I ate there, and tried the Steak Fajita Burrito, I was pretty disappointed.   Meat was dry, and tasteless.  Well, I take that back, it did have a taste, and that was an overwhelming amount of pepper.  I much prefer juicy, steak marinated overnight in Carne Asada seasonings.

Otherwise though, I've had a lot of great experiences here, the chips and salsa, surprisingly enough, are the best reason to stop here.  Usually the people behind the counter do not hesitate to hook you up with a few baskets of deliciously, oil-covered, and warmed chips, and they always keep the salsa bar freshly stocked.

Everything else I've eaten here, aside from the Fajita Burrito, has been great.  Steak Fajitas on fresh tortilla's, Vege Burrito (who knew squash would be so good!,) Nacho's, all good!

Probably some of the better, more authentic-sided Mexican you can find outside of the Mission.
author: Tyler D.

description: I tried Pancho's for the first time today, and it will be my last. Had a chicken burrito and I was not impressed at all... dry, barely warm, and too salty. The chips were not very good either. With all the good burrito shops in SF, there is no reason to settle for this one.
author: Scott S.

description:
I frequent Pancho's far too often, as it is the only Mexican place I have found near me. Not as authentic as the stuff in the Mission, but good and fresh.

I usually get the #1: two chicken tacos, rice & beans. I love the chicken tacos. The tortillas are made fresh to order, and they are generous with the fixins. I generally pass on the rice, but the beans are yummy. The chips are also good.

Salsas...yum! I usually go for the more mild pico de gallo (which still has a good kick to it for a mild sauce) and the HOT tomatillo sauce. I like dipping my burritos and tacos in the hot stuff.

The new salad they introduced is good if you are going that way. Nothing special, but the dressing is good and they give you just the right amount.

The TORTILLA SOUP is the bomb. It is tomato based, garlicky, and yummy. They make it fresh to order, so be prepared to wait for a bit. The pollo soup is also good, especially on a cold day. It comes with a tortilla or two, freshly made.

Nachos are good, as well. The chips are a little thin to hold all the stuff they put on them, so make sure to have a fork handy.

I have tried most of the stuff on the menu, and it is all pretty good. Wow, I spend way to much time there!!
author: Annie F.

description: It hits the spot - not bad - not amazing like some of the spots in the mission. I tried one carnitas and one chicken taco HOLD THE CHEESE. They forgot that part...Alas. The homemade tortillas were the best part. If you need a mexican fix and the line at nick's is too long, this could do the trick.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I've been to Pancho's numerous times; I've eaten in and taken out. They get kudos for consistency, but the food is just OK. This place wins two stars for its proximity to my living quarters. The other star for fast service and good chips. 

The burritos are just OK. I can't put my finger on it, but something is missing. I've sampled the fajitas as well and found them to be underwhelming. 

Could someone please open a GOOD burrito place on Polk, preferably close to my apartment? Thanks!
author: Lara L.

description:
I've only had their burritos so the stars are mainly for the burritos. And I'm not saying the burritos taste bad either, because it doesn't really taste like anything. It's so BLAND!! WHY!? ...meat? ...beans? ...lettuce?? ...pico de gallo?? ...guacamole?? ...sour cream??? Why aren't my taste buds reacting? If you're gonna get a burrito from them, just get the cheapest one becaue it's gonna (not) taste the same anyway. And I also think it's pricey for the size too.

Maybe they're trying to tell us that American burritos have too much stuff inside and it's clashing with each other?? But then why not just take all the extras out and make it an authentic meat burrito?

The tortilla is too dry, or too thick? Because my tongue and the insides of my mouth end up like towel. Oh and so were their limes.

I guess they're trying to compensate for the lack of taste by prettifying the interior, and I personally like their tacky walls with little paintings and pictures and what not, but again I see a lack of taste in them too.

But I will go  back because this is the only taqueria around. *sigh*
author: Seaweed F.

description:
Well, it's better than Taco Bell, which is really one way to consider Pancho's.

No, it's far from the best Mexican/taqueria you'll ever find...the menu's a bit thin, the tortillas have a kind of different/funky taste to 'em, and the prices are a touch higher than what you should probably be paying. 

Still, I'd rather see this than some jive-ass chain...and it fits in really with the scope of Polk Street's diversity.
author: Derek R.

description:
Pancho's is good when I don't feel like trekking to the Mission for a fantastic taco or burrito. It's not the best in town but, it's pretty darn good.

I love the salsa bar. Nice touch with 6 different ones to choose from.

The chicken soup can't be beat. It is a cure-all. Whenever I'm feeling sick I am off to Pancho's to pick this up.

The service is always friendly. 

Not much more to say. I'll be back.
author: J B.

description: Another biting the dust? Sign o' the time? C'mon! This used to be my fave Mex taqueria in the City. Took a long hiatus. Went today. It's gone down the tubes -  but still salvagable. Here's why: - salsas used to be thick, now they're way too watered down (this place is known for its salsa bar); the burritto was loose, not tight , the ingredients were not as fresh as in the past. I still say "Try it!" it wont hurt, but it's not the best anymore...sigh...well, next week I'll try my other Mex fave, and hopefully, I'll find it still a fresh yummy burritto that slam dunks my day!
author: Meg D.

description:
Eh, I had to bring Pancho down a star. Last night, I had a pretty weak burrito. Not only that, for some reason, the burrito chefs placed a single chunk of cheese in the middle of the burrito. it wasn't even melted. Really strange. I don't think the burrito typically comes with cheese. But, that really didn't bother me. I'm all for chunks of cheese. Yet, the steak was extremely dry. Everything wasn't very well mixed into the burrito. The rice was really dry too. 

On top of all that, when I asked for some chips along with the order, the girl at the register asked if I wanted small or large. I paused to think and she recommended I go with the small because she'll put a lot of chips in the bag. I thought, Ok! When we got our order, the bag of chips had, well, a small amount of chips. I would have gone for the large! 

I'll probably still go back though. It's in walking distance, their chips are great, their salsas are awesome and the burritos are generally great. 

Oh, I don't recommend the Chile tortilla for your burrito. It wasn't as good as the normal flour one.
author: Matt S.

description: I am very happy with Pancho's. I have eaten there several times in the past few months and have always been happy. I eat here about once a week and am never disappointed. The salsa bar is small but a nice touch. I don't know if this is authentic Mexican food but I am happy with it.
author: Isaac S.

description:
I've been here a few times and it has been pretty good. Fast and friendly counter service as well. Try the veggie burrito. It is different but tasty.

I just wish they had a rice bowl of some sort.
author: Stu M.

description:
Its ok.  I'm glad its here for when I absolutely must have Mexican food, but nothing has struck me as super delicious.   
One time I found a paint chip in my beans so now I only ever get the steak Fajita burrito cause there aren't any beans in that one.  The chances of that happening again are probably slim so you could have something with beans, I'm just being cautious.
author: Flemm F.

description: I love this place - great salsas, atmosphere and quick service.  I eat here at least once a week for lunch and have tried everything on the menu - i love it all!
author: Nick G.

description: Great decor - lots to look at. Friendly fast service. Ok food.
author: Heart T.

description: The fajita burrito is next to godliness.  No joke.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The restaurant is clean.  I love love love this place.  :)  One dislike....footprints on the ceiling....really?
author: Tiffany G.

description:
The chips and salsa were good.  Steak Burrito not bad.  Nothing spectacular.  Nothing to get excited about.  Maybe I'm ordering the wrong stuff?  

I probably would go back if I was walking by and starving.  Otherwise, I like Nicks better.  Sorry.
author: Noneya B.

description:
For almost five years I used to go in here several times a week for lunch because it is close to work and fairly fast. It isn't mission mexican, but it is serviceable. Then the other day I see they are serving mole enchiladas for $8.99. So I order cheese enchiladas with the mole sauce, but the total is suddenly almost thirteen dollars. I ask why so much?
Usually, the total is just under eleven dollars for cheese enchiladas, which are $7.99 on the regular menu, plus my drink. I expect the total to be a little more because the sign says mole enchiladas are $8.99, but still it seems pretty expensive, so I ask why so much?
The guy says that mole sauce is $1.50 extra. So, I point at the sign that says they are $8.99 and he says that price is for chicken only, and that if I order cheese enchiladas that it is a $1.50 extra, which makes no sense at all to me because cheese enchiladas from the regular menu are $7.99. So I'm already paying a dollar extra for mole sauce even though $8.99 is the regular price for chicken or beef enchiladas, and they are still $8.99, even with mole sauce.
So I ask, for clarification. He is basically trying to charge me $8.99 for $7.99 cheese enchiladas, plus $1.50 extra for mole sauce because I'm not ordering chicken? He says yes. I say no. I'm not paying extra, twice, for something that costs less on the regular menu. Especially since the advertised price for mole enchiladas is the same as the regular price for chicken or beef enchiladas. That just makes no sense at all, no matter what the extra charge might be. They don't charge extra depending on if you want red or green sauce.
Well, way to go amigo! You just lost a customer! I'll get my mole in the mission, where it doesn't cost anything extra, but only for cheese. And my lunches? Well, there is no shortage of places to get lunch along Polk Street.
author: Pause P.

description: Ordered the chicken mole enchiladas dinner plate. Being that it only comes with 2, I asked for 2 more to be added to the order. The male cashier went to the back to ask what to do about this. He came back & rang it up. It wasn't until I had sat down that I realized at looking at the receipt that he had charged me a full plate price for just 2 X-tra. When confronted about the issue both he and another employee proceeded to lie that they were unable to refund or discount the price. It wasn't until they were told that I would come back the following day to speak to the management that I got a cash refund on said item. Watch your wallets at this place. On a good note the food is really good.
author: Chris B.

description: All I order is the bean and cheese burrito, so I don't know if I am a qualified reviewer, but I know I love that burrito, especially with some of their green salsa drizzled on top. Its cheap, it comes with chips, and it comes out fast and fresh. my boyfriend gets the chicken burrito and loves it.
author: Kristen R.

description: Better tacos and burritos can be found a few blocks up the street at Nick's, but I do pop in here occasionally for the nacho plate - Pancho's Nachos (no meat, but it can be added). They make their own chips and tortillas and use grated cheese, which is nice. Their burritos taste a bit off to me so I avoid them.
author: Neil K.

description: It's really hard to mess up a burrito, but these guys managed to do it with the Fajita Burrito. It was full (like 50% full) of sticky white rice, the chicken wasn't seasoned at all and we had to drown the thing in salsa just to create any kind of real taste. The rice overload made the thing really heavy and two of us felt like we had a baseball-sized lump sitting in our stomaches for hours afterward.
author: Austin B.

description:
Cute cute cute inside--I love all the Mexican tackiness! The people are always friendly too.

I pretty much ALWAYS order the Sopa de Pollo (chicken soup for those of you who live under a rock and can't translate it yourself), which is full of chunky veggies, lean chicken, and is accompanied by one of the Pancho's warm, handmade, thick corn tortillas (which are pretty much worth a trip to Pancho's themselves). They even put avocado on top: GENIUS. I would certainly never think to put avocado on/in soup, but it complements it perfectly. It's healthy and cheap, and unfailingly delicious! And the free chips & salsa bar are a yummy plus.

However, the one time that I strayed from my reliable soup, and got the mahi mahi tacos with avocado salsa, I was horrified to discover my mahi mahi with cheese melted on top. Ew. Not genius, and not tasty. But people seem to love the burritos, sopes, chicken mole, quesadillas, etc, so maybe I'll go out on a limb again one of these days...
author: SM A.
