description: Absolutely, the very BEST taqueria in San Francisco and the very first to have a "salsa" bar! Back in 1973, the first taqueria in town opened up on Mission street, near 25th and was aptly called "La Taqueria."   Right now, there must be over 100 taquerias in San Francisco (half of them in the Mission district) and I have tried many of them.. Most of them are pretty good, but none come anywhere near Pancho's. Their fresh, hand-made tortillas (and chips) are better than anything you can get in the country side of old Mexico (forget about Mexico City, the "nixtamal" -grounded corn- from where the tortillas and chips are made is regulated by the government and contains not only corn grain, but the cob and the husk!!!)..San Francisco is very blessed to have this place
author: Victor M.

description: The service is great - they're always really nice. I get carnitas tacos and I have to say, the meat is so much better here than at Nick's - lean and flavorful, falls apart but maintains its texture, in general perfect pork...and I am a pork fiend. The salsas are unlimited and really good. The tortillas are delicious too. I give five stars because going here makes me feel good all over.
author: lauren c.

description: I've been coming here for years - it's part of my hood.  The food is pretty good - certainly the most 'authentic' Mexican food you'll find on Polk Street.  If you want cheaper and/or better - go to the Mission.  Chicken soup is great.  Soft taco dinner is very good with genreous portions.  Salsa bar and chips are an added value.
author: R F.

description: Three of us ate here. My wife thought her steak burrito was just ok--a 3. My daughter felt the same about her burrito. However, she/we felt the chips and salsa were great--fresh, crispy, and tasty. I had the "special" chipoltle tacos and they were just amazing--a 5+. This item you will not find on the menu, but if a special, gobble it up!!  Oh, we also had the nachos--very average--nothing special at all.
author: Vincent N.

description: Love me some good Mexican... this place was alright. I like the  nachos.
author: Marla Y.

description: Panchos ROCKS. It hits the spot every time.. well, to be honest, I have only had the Bronco Burrito about a thousand times...  its this BBQ burrito that is soooo good that I haven't gotten myself to try anything else yet. But my boyfriend always eats different things there and never complains. mmmm
author: Ashley M.

description: I ordered a shrimp burrito which was good. The food came with one basket of chips which costs $1.70 to refill. The drink was free refills. They have a salsa bar with little 2-3 inch plastic containers to put salsa in. The salsa bar had red sauce, green sauce, pico de gallo, pickled jalapenos, beets, and onions with cilantro. Good for cheap food.
author: Sholom J.

description: Perhaps it's not the most "authentic" taqueria in the City, but damn if they don't make a good burrito in the form of the Borracho burrito! Clean, quick service, and a convenient location on Polk Street. Used to go here all the time when I lived in SF, and made it my first stop when I was back in town. Burritos just aren't as good in Austin (although the other Tex-Mex certainly is).
author: Chris B.

description: I eat here at least twice a week. The chicken tacos are great. The guacamole is good. Carnitas awesome. The salsa is always fresh and free. Nice selection of beer on tap and one is always at a special price($2 Dos Equis, Tecate, Anchor Steam and Sierra Nevada). Nice people too! The food is cheap and good. Ask for free chips.
author: Tom D.

description: Ugh....  I went here a couple of times and found it to be weak at best but I kept coming back hoping for something to cling to 'cause I live in Nob Hill.  And so I go in one day and get a carnitas burrito and, I shit you not, it tasted just like Vick's Vapo-Rub.  I understand that everybody has their own interpretation of a burrito, but nobody wants a medicinal petroleum paste stinging their eyes whilst they eat it.  One star for effort.  If you are going to have a crappy mexican place you may as well as take the kiss of death and serve queso dip.  Walk up to Van Ness and hop the 49 to the Mission if you don't want to throw most of your burrito away.  Its worth the trip.
author: Matt S.

description:
it was friday night and even tho i went grocery shopping a couple days ago, nothing beats going out for some mexican food.  my roomy and i being new to the area of Polk St for 5 weeks now, wanted to check out the mexican flavor.

lemme tell ya that the mexican vibe in this neighborhood is not as rich as, say the mission district.  nevertheless we checked yelp and found pancho reviews to be satisfying, yet not stellar.  and that's my conclusion.

i had the borracho burrito and wasn't too fond of the sweetness coming from the bbq sauce.  it was quite overpowering at times.  the steak was good and juicy, the salsa was mediocre.  i think someone was right when they said the tomatoes came from a can. YUCK.  

Grabbed a Corona (oh how cute! they had these lime slices with mexico's flag toothpicked on. SO cute!) and a small order of tortilla chips (thin and crispy) and my burrito as well for $10.00  the price range sounds just about right for what i got.  whoopah!
author: Janina U.

description: Health Dept!!!  I ordered the battered fish tacos.  Before I started eating I noticed dark chunks in the batter.  I tore a couple of these chunks off and found that they were hunks of charred, black, burnt  food from the grill.  I'm not even sure what that stuff was really.  Also, I will never know how that stuff got into the battered fish which never sees the grill.  Disgusting.  I wish I could give no stars.  At least I got my money back.
author: CAKE E.

description: Pancho's clearly means mediocre en espanol...
author: Brian D.

description: OMG, this place is awesome. I live around the corner, but I never went in. I had a steak burrito as well as some nachos, and they were both fabulous. I am picky when it comes to Mexican food, since I hate Cilantro. They got it 100% right - no cilantro-loaded salsa or cilantro flakes in any of my food. Now I'm totally stuffed and am going to take a nap.
author: Maren P.

description: Where are these 5-star reviews coming from?   Have you actually eaten the food or just photographed it with your camera-enabled-phone?  After a long wait for this chicken burritto, I find it to be pouring out grease.  I can deal with some grease (aka vitamin G), but it tasted nasty.   The chicken was all charred and burnt, rice was dry, and was falling apart everywhere.  I consider myself wise in the way of mexican eats, and this place should be avoided at all costs.   Even the chips suck.. maybe the salsa is decent, so pour yourself a glass of salsa and enjoy.    This was not one occation either, food was bad many times.
author: Dan G.

description: What can I say...Nick's was closed so we went here instead for lunch.  It was actually good.  Their tortillas are handmade which really added to their tacos.  The carnitas were good too...no weird fatty pieces.  I would definitely come back BUT only if Nick's were closed ONLY because it's farther away from my house.
author: Kirsten M.

description: My default taqueria spot in the neighborhood. I went astray for awhile, thinking they had lost their edge to Nick's down the street, but I think they've stepped up their game as far as flavor and menu variety is concerned, so I'm back. Had an awesome mushroom quesadilla my most recent visit, and I'm a fan of their Atomic burritos (massive burrito smothered in a spicy red sauce and cheese). Ingredients are really fresh, and they maintain their salsa bar like nobody else. Nice staff. Cool Mexican posters, advertisements and art all over the walls and ceiling. Clean restaurant. Always have gotten good comments from folks I've taken here. Cold pitchers of beer! Jalepeño poppers! Good stuff. Try it.
author: Barbara K.

description: I used to work right next to this place.  For some reason that spot has burrito mojo.  It used to be called Percy's, a burger joint.  They made the best burrito's in the area, even though it wasnt even on the menu.  The burgers were honest, nothing special, just the way i like it.  Pancho's has the best chicken taquitos ever.  You have to eat them there cause the togo box kinda steams em.  Never had the sickly overfull typical post taqueria syndrome, wierd.  The salsa bar is a dream come true for salsa purists.  Remember its all about the combos.  My favorite is the more watery tomato salsa mixed with the chunky tomato one. They have all kinds.  They must hate me cause I reap it.  They even give me an extra large salsa container because I use like ten of the normal ones.  Oh yeah and Bobs is right next door.
author: Hen A.

description: Shrimp atomic burrito (covered in red sauce and cheese). Hungry yet? While this isn't the kind of Burrito you'd expect from the Mission, it's as 'authentic' as Nob Hill can get. Prob best place to grab a quick bit of Mexican in the surrounding area.
author: Navid N.

description: They have a salsa bar which earns one star on it's own.  Specials that you actually want to try and a regular menu that has all the goods: tacos, enchiladas, burritos.  Friendly service, too.
author: T-Bone L.

description:
Synopsis:
The decor is interesting and the food is pretty good. They upped the prices and for that reason, one less star.

The Scene:
Pancho's is basically covered with license plates, plaques, photographs, and other paraphernalia from Mexico. It borders on tacky but as soon as your eyes adjust it doesn't look too bad. With so much going on, there's always something to look at.

The Food:
The Chicken Quesadillas are really good, especially with the homemade corn tortillas. Those things are delicious. The enchilladas are also really good. I would recommend asking them to put the mole sauce instead of the normal sauces because its really good. It's not on the menu, but if you ask, they will do it for you. Make sure that after you pay for your order you ask for tortilla chips. They will give them to you for free. The salsa bar is somewhat limited, but it does the job. Order time is pretty short. The food here tastes best fresh, so I don't fully recommend take-out. I once took some food to go and when I got home the sauces mixed, the tortillas mushed, and it really lost all its magic. Eat there and enjoy the atmosphere.

The Best Part:
The Homemade Corn Tortilla
author: Franc S.

description: I've always been very happy with this location. Good, solid burritos, quick & friendly service, fabulous salsa bar and nice warm, thin chips. Mmm... I once ordered the carnitas tacos here with absolutely wonderful results, too. Highly recommended.
author: Anna S.

description: I love this place.  Great burritos, awesome fresh salsa bar, nice folks.  Get the Borracho burrito with steak - my top choice.  Or the Fajita burrito.  They have $1 beers once in a while too.
author: Ben K.

description: I really like Pancho's.  I used to live around the corner so I was a regular, but their Chicken Fajita burrito is really tasty and really filling.  They have an excellent salsa bar with hot peppers, several kinds of salsa, and the like.  They include lots of chips with any order, and the food all around is just top notch.  They generally have some sort of special of the day.  Pancho's is a tad expensive, it'll set you back like 8 bucks, and the Mission clearly has superior burritos, but that said, this place is really good.  It would put most cities burritos to shame.
author: Jim D.

description:
what i ate:

whole wheat tortilla, beans, rice (with no chicken broth), house-made salsa, onions, the good thin house-fried chips, $4. 

no complaints. perky girl with dimples working the register. she was awesome.
author: Sunny Joy B.

description: Mmmmm, their homemade sopa de pollo (hearty chicken, vegetables, and broth) and tortilla soup are the best things since sliced bread!  My mouth is watering just thinking about them.
author: Maya G.

description: I work in the area and i must admit this place isnt the best place to get mexican food. They charge a higher price for lower quantity/quality. And the name plenty of us get mistaken for Pancho Villa.
author: Frank M.

description: I'm sure this place doesn't compete with Mexican food in the Mission, but it kicks the crap out of Nick's which seems to always screw my order up.  Has pretty good prices, friendly staff, and is just close enough that I can walk to it drunk!
author: simon r.

description: Ay, mi Panchito's, cómo te quiero!
author: Rafa R.

description: I'll repeat what others have said.  Baraccho Burito.  Get it.  Trust me.
author: Brett J.

description: Panchos is very close to my home and hence my husband and I frequent it often.  If this restaurant were in any other state, it would be a 5-star Mexican establishment.  Here in SF, with all the great Mexican food, I give it a solid 4-stars.  The food is fresh and consistently delicious.  Try the atomic burrito; it is a lot less spicy than advertised and exceptionally tasty.  Evertyhing is great.
author: Abby T.

description: Sorry, Carlos. I used to really like this place, but it's since gone waaay down hill. I just ate there on Halloween, and  man, this was a real disappointment. Chicken enchilada platter: beans were like little rabbit turds! Hard and rolling around everywhere! Rice was bland! Chicken was just in a big lump stuffed inside the tortilla! The only thing good was that the staff are extremely friendly. I think I can make a better burrito at home, even if my only Latina heritage is from living close to TJ.
author: eliz s.

description: a co-worker took me here the other day because i was sick and she said they had good chicken soup...boy was she right!! i've been back twice for the soup and have a craving for it all the time. it's like grandma used to make only with avocado slices on top and cilantro. SUPER TASTY. also, their black bean salad is really yummy. if you're looking for a lightish lunch at a mexican restaurant (generally somewhat hard), get a cup of the soup and a side of the bean salad and you'll feel like a million bucks.
author: Cristabel L.

description:
I'll start by saying that the service here is really good. I've been about a half dozen times and they've been friendly and fast each time.

The burritos are really good but the chips taste a little funny. It makes me wonder how often they change out the cooking oil. The salsa bar is always a plus so points for that.
author: Yelper S F.

description:
ok, update.  their burritos are fairly good.  inconsistent, but i find myself craving a chicken burrito from there every now and then.  the hot sauce at the salsa bar is quite tasty.

also, the phone in order finally worked the way its suppose to.  good job panchos.  

result: bonus star.  maybe a star and a half.

*************
Burritos are not very good here.  The salsa bar is pretty good though.

Also what i really don't like is that if you place a phone order, they don't start making it until you come in... which equals more waiting.  That's annoying.  It would be very nice if I call in my order, and by the time i get there, i can just pay for it and leave.

Despite all this, you'll still find me here from time-to-time... I need my Mexican food fix!!
author: shaun l.

description: Pancho's is perfectly adequate when I am too lazy to venture to a better, but further away taqueria. When I ask for avocado in my burrito they are generous with it, even though I sometimes have to eat 1/3 of the way through my burrito to hit a giant avocado pocket.  Chips are pretty decent. There are better places for Mexican around town, but if you are in Nob Hill and craving Mexican, Pancho's satisfies.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
after a four-hour bike ride over the golden gate to fairfax and back, a guy could really got for a delicious breakfast burrito to replenish some lost carbs. this is just the place for that. that was one of the larger, more delicious burritos i have had in quite some time.

this is a fairly typical mexican joint. it's a bit unlike the mission joints where you walk down the line, but they serve most of the same food. their soft drinks come in tiny wax cups, which is annoying just because i hate going up for refills. and there IS a bathroom if you need it - it's in the back of the kitchen. there's one table setup outside if the weather's nice, and plenty of seating indoors.

nob hill scares me - not as much as the marina, but it's still weird to find myself there. but if i happen to be over there, i'd like to drop back in to pancho's for a regular burrito and see how that compares..
author: Jeremiah W.

description: I had the best nachos I've ever had in my life last night. I haven't tried anything else here but I bet it's damn good. This is now one of my favorite Mexican food places in the city.
author: Monique O.

description: Chicken burritos. Salsa. Super friendly staff. 'nuff said: go there now!
author: Roland A.

description: Polk street options for Mexican food are slim.  Pancho's burritos are ok, the salsa bar is ok and the service is friendly.  I want to give 4 stars but the food is just so average I cant bring myself to do it.  Plus I think their prices are too high for what you get.  Better than Nick's crispy tacos down the street but for great Mexican food, one has to leave the neighborhood.
author: Nilu r.

description: My favorite mexican place within walking distance but I would go even if it wasn't just down the block. If you go, you should try the two taco plate with rice and beans. It is around $7, which seems like more then your used to but you get what you pay for. I like to get one steak and one chicken taco. Both are served on homemade corn tortillas, with lots of delicious guacamole (enough to dip your chips a little). The only thing, if you go with more then one person and you order together, they try and stiff you on the chips. I don't know why. They have a SALSA bar for a reason don't they? Just ask for the large basket of chips and they will usually "upgrade" free of charge (sometimes it is an extra $1).
author: Becca A.

description: i'd take a mission taqueria any day over pancho's but this is a decent option if you're on polk street and want a mexican plate. they have a good variety of options and burritos are decent, but i prefer nick's down the street if i'm craving a taco or burrito.
author: Helen T.

description: I wish I could write a big long review of this place's menu but I can't seem to get past the plain ol' bean and rice burrito with trimmings.  I get it every time.  (Creature of habit.)   All summed up it's a good place to get a cheap Mexi-meal.
author: Argonaut A.

description:
The food was Meh. Made me feel kinda sick afterwords. Might of given it 2 stars. but...

What really chapped my a$$ was the fact that the guy brought my nachos out and they had chicken instead of steak. Honest mistake right? WRONG!!! I took my food back to the counter and told the cashier that my order was wrong and he said "We ran out of steak" What!!!  Were they just gonna try to sneak this by me? Where they too lazy to leave the kitchen and ask? I have a good friend that is allergic to poultry what then? 

This was unacceptable, just come out and tell me before you make the food. I might have just ordered something else.
author: Dani Z.

description: Oh my gosh, this place is so awesome!  Freshly made tortillas, great meats with their tacos and burritos, the best nachos you'll find and everything is so authentically Mexican you'll become an instant regular to this place.  The ambience is very condusive to a good dining experience and the service is excellent and very friendly.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Pancho's is great for a quick lunch.  The tacos are fresh and tasty, and the salsa bar is a welcome addition while you're waiting for your food to be brought to you.  Though the food was not bad by any means, I was neither floored by authenticity nor style, and felt that much tastier tacos might be found at Nick's a short walk away.  Pancho's might make a nice spot for an afternoon snack and beer with friends, if one doesn't mind fast-food type decor.
author: MScott S.

description: Good cheap eats!  I wish they had more salsa selections, but the ones they have are good.  The menu is pretty expansive and the food averages around $7.  They even have beer to go with my yummy tacos.  I would say try it out!
author: Rise G.

description: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food of this restaurant but fresh ingredients and homemade tortillas are good.
author: willie l.

description:
I eat at Pancho's once every six months or so. It's close, it's convenient, and about twice I year I'm bored or hungry enough to give it another try.  

Maybe they've gotten better since last time, I think to myself.

My optimism is never rewarded.  Dry meat, bland salsa, 'home-style' corn tortillas that taste like carpet...  in a word, 'Meh.'  

I've never actually eaten anything there that made me gag, or take the food back (although the enchiladas came close), but I'd steer clear of this place if any other burrito joint in a three mile radius is open.
author: Trevor G.

description: I had the nachos here and they were pretty good, but they were also $8.50!!!  This is Taqueria food, not the Ritz Carlton.  While watching the cooks, I noticed they were mad skimpy with the some of ingrediants in the burritos too.  It's just cheese guys, hook it up.
author: matthew w.

description: Great salsa options and tasty nachos with yellow and orange chips. Yumbo! Good value.
author: A Y.

description:
this place is highly underrated by most.  sure, it ain't the mission, but pretty darn good burritos this side of market.

i say hells yes to pancho's chicken fajita burrito.
author: Joanne L.

description:
i love Nick's Crispy Taco's fish taco... and compare to that, Pancho's Baja Style Fish Taco is so much better. it definitely has a better flavor. perhaps it's cause of the home made corn tortillas.

try it.
author: Dot K.

description: This place is OK. As far as taco's are concerned, you may want to check out Nick's down the street. But Nick's is more of a gourmet type taco whereas Pancho's is more of your traditional taqueria. If you live in the area, and are in need of a taqueria, I suppose it's your best bet. There is El Super Burrito down the street, but yuck, don't go there.
author: M S.

description: I live in the neighborhood and come here for my Monday night burrito fix.  I always get the same thing: a chicken fajita burrito.  It's not phenomenal, but it does the trick.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
This place may not be uber-authentic, but when I need a good burrito made with homemade tortillas, this is where I go!  I've had the sopa de pollo as well and it hit the spot!  Your food is made quickly and the staff is friendly.  The prices are right on.

The decor is kitsch without being annoying, but we usually take out.
author: Sarah H.

description:
The best thing here is anything that contains the homemade corn tortillas.  The tacos, the quesadillas - yummy!  The tortilla is fresh and slightly thick, which adds up to delicious.  They also have the best carne asada tacos I've had in a long time: the beef is fresh, tended and lean (I hate it when you order a steak taco and get a beef-flavored lard taco instead).  I'd recommend forgoing the burritos because they're nothing to rave about... standard hole in the wall fare.

About the atmosphere: generally I hate restaurants that have lots of "flair" on the walls.  But Pancho's manages to pull it all together and be more interesting than obnoxious.  My favorite is a painting of a rotund man in a dress... stylin!
author: Alisa N.

description:
i think i would really give this place 2 stars but im just too nice!
defiantly not the best mexican food in sf, or the area for matter
but... their veggie burrito is better than nick's crispy tacos 
its actually pretty good, basically when im feeling too lazy to walk any further.
they are really nice and its not too expensive and its decorated really fun, you never run out of things to look at while youre eating...
author: cate d.

description: Middle of the road, convenient Mexican.  Right outside my place, which is a huge plus...slow takeout is a small minus.  My favorite so far is the chicken tacos, but I really just think that's because their corn tortillas are awesome.  I would give 3.5 stars if I could, because I just remembered that their chips are perfectly crispy and they have guacamole to die for (which is making me fat).
author: Alison P.

description: Decent burritos. The regular chicken is good. If you like BBQ, go for the Borracho.
author: Steve S.

description: My husband and I drove into town to see our son play at a club down the street from Pancho's.  We were hungry and didn't have much time so we thought this place would fill the ticket.  We were pleasantly surprised because the food was pretty decent...not the best but we weren't expecting great.  The chips and salsa's were wonderful and if you do try this place, you have to order their homemade tortilla's....they are 5 stars.  Worth trying if you are in the area.
author: Shell M.

description: I had lunch here with a bunch of friends one afternoon.  The general consensus was that the food was good, but nothing to write home about.  If I was in the neighborhood and wanted a burrito, I would probably go here again....but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Luci B.

description: I wanted to like Pancho's, I really did.  Their combo #3 sounded right up my alley, a cheese quesadilla and a small chicken burrito with a side of guacamole, but I wasn't that impressed.  The burrito was kinda wierd, there was way too much lettuce and sour cream, and the quesadilla was only okay.  I'd give the combo three stars, but I had to knock them down a star for the flan we ordered.  I've eaten a lot of flan over the years and this was the worst flan I've ever had.  It had literally no taste at all.  Overall Panchos seemed like a nice place, but the food just didn't do it for me at all.
author: Rich C.

description: After a really bad experience, went back and they're way better.   Good food, friendly service.  And speedy, but still good food.
author: beth s.

description:
Pancho's is the home of the Baracho Burrito.  If that doesn't mean anything to you, go have a try!

Chips are great, and free with my burrito.  There are things on the menu that aren't great.  And there is SF's best burrito.  Quesadillas are good.  Chips are good when hot, okay later.  Beer is cheap if you order off the special board.   All this without having to trek to Valencia St.?  What's not to love?

It's not Gary Danko.  But I can afford to make myself happy here everyday.
author: Craig R.

description: Killer salsa bar. I still think the Inner-Richmond location is better. Sorry Mark S.
author: bill a.

description:
LOVE the Chicken Borracho Burrito!!  They put some sort of Mexican BBQ sauce in it that I just CRAVE.  And those Baja Fish Tacos are some of the best fish tacos in the city.  And they always keep the restaurant so clean, unlike other taquerias in town.

And you can't go wrong with the Pancho's Happy Hour!
author: Mick B.

description: Out of the two I've been to, this is like my favorite place to get burritos.  My boyfriend's favorite things are the atomic burrito (veggie, of course) and the green salsa.  I love the chicken taco salad and the chicken fajita burritos are amazing.  The neighborhood is sketch, but there is an amazing donut place nearby!
author: Olivia S.

description: to many, polk street is one of the best streets in san francisco. i concur. restaurants, bars, shops, cafes. it's got it all, except a decent taqueria. and that's a big shame... panchos is probably the closest thing to a taqueria on polk, but that's not saying much. the food is just average here. it's often bland and dry. definitely can't measure up to mission taquerias or even, * gasp * baja fresh. * gasp again * wow! did he really say that? hell yeah i did. that is how disappointed i am with polk street when it comes to taqueria options, or lack there of. sad. really sad.
author: frisco j.

description: We just moved to the area recently, and though the burritos may not be as goods as those in the mission, this is a great substitute and it's very cheap.  The veggie burritos are great, the service is fast and friendly, and the decor is vibrant and clean.  Also, the salsa bar is a fun plus.  I'd go here if you're in the neighborhood and craving solid mexican food.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
i love this joint. there, i said it.  pancho's #1 combo (1 steak, 1 grilled chix taco) is absolutely fanfuggintastic.  the salsa bar is on point if they do bless you with tortilla chips...consider yourself lucky if you do receive golden deep fried salty gifts from the trans-fat gods!  
moving on...the staff are just as pleasant as the hand-made corn tortillas, they are  f'n amazing!!  why are you reading this and not eating pancho's taco(s)?  
i can honestly say that my meals here blew Mexico DF out the water.  Granted i ate there once, but the "chipotle" chix tacos left much to be desired.  EAT @ PANCH'S!!  Don't be a pinche cavron!....pindejo puta!** hehehehe!!!


**all Spanish and spelling learned in restaurant kitchens
how's that for opinionated?

***PPS:  The burracho (sp?) is fucckking amazing!!!!  especially since there was a small sampling of a not-so-vintage strain of Trainwreck that inspired my appetite almost immediately.   This burro may have inspired my taste buds to pack up and head straight towards Kansas City...or Austin.  Guess I'll let the yelpers choose for me :)
author: Karl H.

description: I wouldn't recommend the tacos here, but the burritos are quite tasty.  I especially like that they sell "small" versions of their burritos for days when I'm feeling just a little less gluttonish.  Friendly staff and good service as well!
author: Sally A.

description: I HAD A BURRITO WITH A SMALL BLACK ROCK IN IT. I CRACKED MY TOOTH, AND THE COUNTER GUY SAID THERE ARE ALWAYS ROCKS IN THE BLACK BEANS WHEN THEY GET THEM, AND THEY TRY TO SORT THEM OUT WHEN THEY WASH THEM BUT THEY CAN'T GET THEM ALL... I AM REPORTING THIS PLACE TO THE SF HEALTH DEPT AND ASKING THAT THEY BE SHUT DOWN.
author: rik f.

description: The food is a bit gringo, but good quality and at a fair price.
author: Oleg A.

description:
I'm a life long Mexican food addict but I've avoided Pancho's for the past 5 years (despite the fact that it is located one block from my apartment) primarily because it looks like a typical whitewashed Mexican joint.  I broke down today and gave it a shot.  This place is embarassingly bad and I absolutely cannot believe that this place gets decent Yelp reviews.  I started with the tortilla soup.  The lady behind the counter told me that I could not have avocado and cheese, only one or the other.  Very strange.  I opted for the cheese - this was the first time I'd ever had tortilla soup without avocado.  Not to worry, though, because no avocado could have salvaged this "soup."  The soup had so many tortilla chip strips in it, that you could barely get to the broth - the texture was compaprable to an oatmeal.   Truly nasty.  Then came my enchilada combination platter.  Oh boy.  I had asked for one cheese and one chicken enchilada but they had told me they could not accomodate such a request and that I would need to choose one or the other?  Really?  Why?  That's strange.  Don't you make these to order?  No.  They are pre-made and frozen.  Lovely.  Literally the worst enchiladas I have ever had -- hardly any cheese, awkwardly hard tortilla, I could go on.  The beans and rice were terrible -- black beans, barely warm with a tiny bit of cheese sprinkled on top.  I think the moral of this story is simple: If you want to eat here (why for the love of god would you do such a thing?) you should just go with a burrito because it's impossible to screw up a burrito.  Alternatively, you could get down to the mission and eat good Mexican food.  It's somewhat ironic that my favorite and least favorite Mexican food spots in SF both have the word "Pancho" in their name.  

One positive: The chips were good.  Light and warm.
author: Randy L.

description: The only reason I ever go to this place is because it is so close.  Nick's Crispy Taco's is superior Mexican food, so as long as I'm not feeling really lazy, Pancho's isn't getting my business.  Burritos, tortas, and tacos are all below average.  The tacos are often soggy and I'm always a little disappointed with the quality of ingredients.
author: Luke P.

description: For a Mexican restaurant in San Francisco, this place is mediocre.  I have been living in the hood for 6 years and I rarely eat there.  The burritos are ok and the tacos are not great.  The service is not bad.  All in all, it is not one of the better places to eat Mexican food.
author: Matt J.

description: i haven't actually eaten much of their food, but the burritos are enormous and look good.  the agua fresca is made on the spot and is excellent...i had the watermelon!
author: Roshni R.

description: got a chicken fajita burrito.. in spinach tortilla, which was perhaps a bad call. the chicken just wasn't very good... kind of dry, hard to chew. the salsa, veggies, and rice were decent. the salsa bar was okay, their salsa fresca was good, the other stuff was not. basically, like the 3 star symbolizes.. it was a-ok.
author: Jessica W.

description: I had a delicious dinner at Pancho's tonight - warm, fresh corn tortillas with carnitas; a rich tortilla soup; and a cold beer. For a small Mexican spot on Polk, it's a gem. The staff is also worth noting. I left my purse in the restaurant and when my boyfriend when back to get it, the staff had placed it behind the counter and everything was still inside. I'm very grateful.
author: Emily H.

description:
i was recommended this place by a fellow yelper. i had been here once before a couple months ago but decided to give it another try. 

first strike occurred when they ignored me for several minutes while i stood at the counter. next strike was the super rude worker. i got tamales to go.  the salsa bar is nice though, so much cleaner than el super burrito. the hot salsa, the orangey one,  tastes like burnt socks though, but the pico and the green one were both above par.

next strike is that they throw chips in the same steaming box with the food, so of course they're steamed and stale tasting by the time you get home. luckily, i had some mission chips in the cabinet. the tamales were super bland, but they did seem genuine. they were wrapped in several layers of pesky banana leaves. 

overall, the food was mediocre, but i probably would check this place out again just because it's close and it's way cleaner than el super burrito.
author: Saikat P.

description: Cheap and very tasty.  Two char-grilled chicken taco plate is what i usually get.  Different types of freshly-made salsa to choose from.  They also have coke in a bottle and cheap beer.
author: Tom Z.

description: The juevos rancheros made my BF's stomach churn.  I had the nachos, which were pretty good.  But I don't think I'll go back unless I'm desparate for mexican on polk st since I banned La Parilla.
author: LT B.

description: The two taco plate is awesome!  They have, by far the best corn tortillas I have ever eaten.  The salsa bar is great and they have cheap pitchers of beer.
author: Brooks O.

description: Most of the time it is GREAT.  Food is fresh.  Salsa is awesome.  The specials are always interesting.  The burritos are fresh:  the salad is crunchy, the tomatoes are fresh, the sour cream is awesome.  The peole there are friendly and it is very reasonably priced.
author: Charles P.

description: Not even close to the best burritos/Mexican in the city, but it's close to home and they have pickled jalapenos on the salsa bar - sweet.  The food is passable, the people are nice, the tables are clean AND they have $2 beers, so if you are walking by and hungry, it is worth stopping in.
author: Matt A.

description: another good nob jill mexican restruaun and well fed, and portions, good veg options
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.

description: chips are good here - thin-ish and crispy and they have a pretty o.k salsa bar. try the borracho burrito...sweet tangy sauce - it's excellent. some nights they have $1 beers - what's better than $1 sierra's and a huge burrito?
author: Rachel S.

description: only ever had the fish tacos. they're really, really good. crispy and deep fried. highly recommended.
author: erik l.
